reviewDescription: Super cute and heats up well, easily portable for work. I put whatever I'm eating in the inner bowl with the lid and stick it in the fridge overnight. Then put it inside the crockpot part to take it to work the next day where I keep it on my table and plug it in around an hour before lunch break. I get a hot meal without having to go use the crappy breakroom microwave. The inner lid can be a little tricky and is just plastic which kind of threw me off, but so far it seems to work well and it easy to clean.

reviewTitle: 20 oz crock pot portable food warmer
reviewDescription: I recently bought the 20 oz. Crock-Pot portable warmer, and it has exceeded my expectations. This compact and versatile warmer is perfect for keeping my meals hot on the go. The size is ideal for single servings or small portions, and it fits easily into my bag or lunchbox. The variety of colors available is a nice touch, allowing me to choose one that suits my style. It heats evenly and maintains the temperature effectively, ensuring that my food stays warm throughout the day. The durable construction and easy-to-clean design are added bonuses. I highly recommend this portable warmer for anyone needing a reliable and stylish solution for keeping their meals hot and ready.

This mini crock pot has been absolutely amazing to use. The microwaves are crap at my work, since using this thing I've had a piping hot meal every single day. I found with the microwave at my work the top would be super hot and bottom still cold as if it came out of the fridge. When using this the food is hot from top to bottom. The bowl size looks small but it's really deceiving, I'm a bigger guy (230lbs) and the portion size is perfect. The lid to seal the bowl seals really well, but it is easy to think you screwed it on properly and it isn't, you know that it's not on properly when you go to heat it up, then maybe 30 minutes in the lid pops off and makes a pretty loud noise, but no big deal, I screw it back on properly and it continues to go to work. The light on the exterior of the pot is nice so that you know it's on and working. I would say to get the food to it's hottest point you gotta leave it plugged in for about 2 hours. But I've found 1.5 hours heats it to about 90% which is still good enough. Washing the bowl is a little tough once the pot is off it gets cold pretty quickly, I'd say in 10-15 minutes, if you don't wash it right away the food will get hard and stick to the side of the bowl, and it can be a hassle to remove, but not impossible by any means, just need some elbow grease. Other then that I have no complaints with it, I absolutely love it and it's been a game changer for work lunches. Definitely recommend.

I got this to keep knox warm for my daughter's artistic swimming team. This does not disappoint! The knox stays hot, clump free, and is easy to apply. The only downside is that it's really hot so we have to be careful when applying. I will never go back to making knox without the crockpot!

This little Crock Pot lunch box is so handy for heating left overs or canned soups.  Use it only for heating.  It does not reach a high enough temperature that uncooked foods will heat to an internal temperature of 165°F.  Because it is a lower temperature, food does not burn, and it cleans so easily.  I also like that I don't have to stand and watch over it.  It takes a while to heat the food, but i can do something else while I wait.  The cord is not too short.

reviewTitle: Perfect for a hot lunch at work
reviewDescription: I plugged it in about 30 minutes before lunch and it heated it up perfectly. Definitely make sure you pop the streamer valve when you plug it in. I love the way it has a plug holder for the cord - super easy to transport . Nice, light and well made with a good handle. It won't close if you don't notch the hold with the tiny post (see picture). I made vegan butter chickpea (testing a recipe).

I have had this little crockpot for over a year now and it is the best thing I have purchased from Amazon!  I do not like to use the breakroom microwave and this allows me to plug in my lunch when I get to work and it is hot at lunch time.  I have put everything in this from soup to pulled BBQ Beef. If I put anything besides soup in it, like leftover lasagna or BBQ beef then I add a little water for moisture and it comes out perfect!  Reheating rice is amazing - the microwave dries it out but this little crockpot creates steam which keeps it moist.  There is no smell until I take the lid off.  I have so many compliments from others in my office that I have no doubt that I have sold a few more for Amazon....I should get a commission!I do have one design improvement.  The power cord is meant to be rolled up on the bottom and stored under the crockpot.  I do not know why but after a few months it is too lose.  It won't stay attached and falls off when I pick up the crock pot.  Better clips or a retractable cord or something would be better!I highly recommend this little pot!  I bought for my daughter who is an athletic trainer and she loves it as well.  She can take her dinner and during half-time or practices she has a hot meal to eat without needing a microwave.

I've had my little Crock-Pot in my office for a little over a year now and I have grown to love it more every time I use it. While my colleagues are going out for lunch and spending $12 to $15 for a sandwich for lunch, I'm sitting in my office having a hot lunch for a fraction of the cost. Today I heated spaghetti sauce and frozen meatballs, prepared my pasta in the microwave and by lunch time, while they're all gone searching out sandwiches, I'm eating a hot lunch of spaghetti and meatballs. Tomorrow I'm making shrimp, green beans, coconut milk and I'll have that over rice. I am so impressed by what this little Crock-Pot can do. I chose the blush pink. The only problem I'm having is getting the inner lid off after my food is hot. I'm sure it's me and not the machine. However I do have a hard time getting it off. For me it's extremely hard to twist off. I don't actually see any threads as to how the lid seals. It does seem to twist on, but I can't untwist it to remove it. That does not stop me from using it nearly every day. I live in the North and it's wonderful in the winter months not to have to travel out during lunch time in search of food. I prepare at home, the night before and have a nice hot meal without having to go into the snow, looking for an expensive sandwich or cold lunch. I recommend you get one, or two... your family said it's okay

This has helped me so much in not eating out for lunch. I always want quick and easy, but also hate some of my food reheated in the microwave.This is the perfect size to take for lunch, no spill in the car. I can plug it in while I finish my morning appointments and it’s ready for when I want to eat. Highly recommend if you are trying to stay in a budget or keep from eating out but still want hot good food. Works good with meal prep as well.

reviewTitle: Saves me a Ton of money!
reviewDescription: I have been using a "Lunch" crock pot for about 5 yrs.  Prior to that I would spend at least $15 per day for lunch on foods that were expensive and not good for me. Now some may complain about price of this pot but compared to buying lunch working in downtown Manhattan, N.Y. its chump change! Over the last 5 yrs I have saved a ton of money average $15 per day x's 20 days per month which is $300 x 12 months =  $3600 x5yrs came out to $18000.  Yay!  😁🤑

reviewTitle: I love/loved my older model, this newer version is terrible and I do not recommend it
reviewDescription: This is a terrible replacement for my previous model and I deeply regret purchasing it. I regret even more that I was so busy I didn't test out the replacement till the return period had closed. I was ok with replacing my older verion when it was getting worn out, especially because I thought "oh good, I can still use the old pot/liner in the new device so I have a backup and can pre-pack 2 lunches at once".WRONG. I was wrong, the new one is awful. And not just that- it's pretty obvious to me that this new items was deliberately designed to make it impossible for me to use the older pot/liner with the new device.The new thing has a pin sticking up from the rim, and the new pot insert has a little hole for that pin. The old pot cannot be used because it doesn't have that hole in it. (Though I can use the new pot with the old heater, since the pin/hole doesn't appear to do anything at all but cause a problem, so the machine works fine without it.) And the pin sucks even with the pot it was designed for. Both models of this item I own have hotspots in them (which is pretty common for electronics in this price range, so I coped). To balance that out, I'd spin the inner pot in the middle of the heating cycle to try to keep the heat even and prevent scorching. It took like 2 seconds and didn't require me to make contact with the food. I can't do that anymore, I have to open the lid and stir with a spoon/fork.Basically I wasted a chunk of money on a new item which is in EVERY WAY worse than the older model, and is deliberately worse. If you love your older model crockpot lunch heater, DO NOT expect this item to be as functional or useful. Here's hoping this review saves someone else the money and frustration I've wasted on this thing.

I really liked this crock pot lunch warmer. It is spacious. It takes a little while to actually heat the food which isn’t a problem. The reason why I give it three stars is because after the first use the color faded around the top of the bowl.My friend has the greenish one and hers was just fine. I don’t know if it’s this particular color that does that or the one I had was defective. The bowl is easy to use. It’s very easy to open. The lid seals nicely. There was no leakage. It’s lightweight. The outside doesn’t get hot so it won’t burn you while it’s heating. It is very safe to use. If it didn’t start peeling I would have kept it and gave it 5 stars.

It certainly warms veggies quickly, but it's far too difficult to open in general and even harder once hot. There's a prong to keep the inner liner from turning but on the second use the encasement broke, making the prong useless. Trying to use the carrying handle didn't help as it's kinda flimsy and that popped out. There's no way to get a grip enough to open it when it's time to eat.I'm requesting a refund and going back to thermoses.

reviewTitle: The Pop scares me to death
reviewDescription: I've used mini crockpot heaters for almost a decade now and they are progressively needing! I be replaced more often. This one is smaller than the one I used to get, but I can still fit lunch in it. The biggest issue is the lid makes a loud pop sound when heating. I'm not sure what's causing this but it scares me and makes me jump unexpectedly every time it happens.

This is absolutely adorable, but is smaller than I anticipated. I purchased as a gift and it's still in the box due to size and unsure what exactly to even put in it due to size. Love the idea of this though, just wish it was bigger.

It was great for the first 3 months and then it just stopped heating at all. The light would turn on and nothing would happen. Even tried multiple outlets. Would have given it 5 stars, but for almost $40 I expect it to last more than 3 months.
I didn’t realize that it was so small

reviewTitle: take to long to heat it up
reviewDescription: take too long to heat it up

My daughter is autistic and won’t eat school lunches and also requires warm food. This was perfect until it caught fire in the classroom. The teacher said she left the room for two minutes. I’m so glad no one was hurt! This crockpot has always been plugged in by an adult. Very scary!

Very nifty and great for hot meals on the go. I gave it to my boyfriend for one of his Christmas gifts. He actually reads instructions haha. Used it a few times, then last week he went to eat his dinner, overnight 12 hr shift, and the main lid wouldn't come off, he said he tried everything and had to throw the whole thing away ☹️ it broke my heart my man was hungry all night.

I bought this for work.  Due to personal reasons didn't get a chance to use it until now.  It Does NOT heat up food (soup) from a shelf stable box of soup.  Hence, it wasn't food that was cold from fridge it was straight out of the box of soup.I plugged it in as soon as I got to work at 6:30am...lunch at 1pm and soup was barely plateable or warm.If I could return, I would.  Waste of Money!!!Guess it will go in the donation bin or trash can as it doesn't warm up basic chicken noodle soup let alone try other foods.

Use this every day at the office to warm my canned soup for lunch. I plug it in at 9 and the vegetables are soft by noon, but not melt in your mouth soft. It doesn't boil my soup. At any rate, there is a design flaw with this product that took me a while to figure out. Namely, the bowl is made of metal but the screw on lid to the bowl is made of plastic. The result of this is that the heat expands the plastic lid much more than the metal bowl thereby creating a tremendous seal by the expanded lid. It makes it very, very hard to unscrew the expanded lid while my soup is still warm. Before I realized what was happening, I had to carefully use pliers to unscrew the heat expanded lid. Not safe. Now I just lay the plastic lid on top of the metal bowl. Even then, it is sometimes still hard to get off due to it expanding more than the metal bowl. The concept is good but the design is flawed. I would not buy this product again.

reviewTitle: Sliced fingers trying to open inner lid
reviewDescription: The lid to the inner container is very difficult to screw on, and is almost impossible to remove after food is heated.  The metal pin doesn’t hold it in place, so you have to remove the (hot) inner container from the outer plastic one and struggle with it on your lap in the office when all you want is your lunch. I managed to get it open finally, but got deep cuts on my fingertips from something sharp inside the rim of the inner lid.  This is a cute item and I was happy to receive it as a Xmas gift, but my fingers bled thru 3 bandaids and all over my desk, so I’m not able to recommend this product.
I used it one time, and it didn't work the second time. Unacceptable.

reviewTitle: I have a major issue with this item...
reviewDescription: ...I gave  5 stars for portion size, leak proof and easy to clean but overall only one star for a specific reason...after cooking the threaded top is so tight that you can't just spin it to release it...because the inner cylinder/lining also spins requiring you to place pressure on the hot outside edge of the cylinder next to the top to hold it in place creating a burn issue...you either have to use some sort of a potholder or maybe a wadded paper towel to place pressure on the outside inner lining edge which is a poor design. I tried to lubricate it using olive oil but the top is simply too tight. Clearly a safety issue for burning your fingers. There should have been something to lock the inner cylinder/lining in place to avoid the issue. I'm surprised to one mentioned this. As far as I'm concerned this is a serious product defect.

reviewTitle: I HATE that I'm giving this a one star review
reviewDescription: I love this product. It's the perfect size, it's the perfect heat, it's perfectly convenient. The problem is that the plastic part with the metal post on the base spins around if you have to use even a little bit of force to untwist the lid from the pot - the agony of being hungry for lunch and not being able to access the food sitting right in front of me. I ordered a replacement, praying this was just a quality control issue. LO AND BEHOLD, I am now sitting here once again, hungry and unable to open my food because the plastic base just twists around and around as I try to twist the lid off.
My latte wouldn’t even fit in this crock pot. Deceivingly tiny.

Crock-Pot Electric Lunch Box, Portable Food Warmer for Travel, Car, On-the-Go, 20-Ounce, Black Licorice | Keeps Food Warm & Spill-Free | Dishwasher-Safe | Gifts for Women, Mennot for travel or on the go,and I cant even buy a port for the car, selling on FB marketplace

reviewTitle: Inner lid is stuck, can't even open.
reviewDescription: Crockpot is cute and I'm sure I'd really enjoy using it if I could just get the inner lid to come off.  The outer lid came off with no problem, but the inner lid that seals the food/liquid inside absolutely will NOT budge.  Will have to return for a replacement, unless someone else had the same problem and can tell me how to remove the inner lid?
This is a baby size lunch box. The lunch for an adult will not fit.

I like that it is small and portable. Love to toss mt soup, chilli or whatever else I want in it to warm up while I work. I don't have ti share the microwave and wait for the guys to get done. No fishy, pizza dinner for me. Deffinantly recommend this. It must be plugged in to be warm. Stays warm for maybe an hour after it's unplugged. Precooked what your making in it. Doesn't work like a normal crockpot.... not for cooking just warming.

This is too cute and compact!Not the most quality/heavy material but not the worst and cheap feeling. Threw in my leftover potatoes immediately, started cleaning, came back after 45 min and it felt like I microwaved them for about 4 min, piping hot. The lid locks nicely. Perfectly fits a can of soup or chili. All metal parts around the rim do get pretty hot.It’s my fav for lazy cooking, nothing too instant, love multi-tasking while warming up food.UPDATE: Been using this for about 5 months and I still use this nearly every day. I’m super forgetful and hitting the microwave over and over again gets annoying/ruins the food. Also, everything's still in good shape. Handle is strong; sometimes I grip the handle go help twist the cap off and it’s pretty strong. Inner metal bowl looks the same. The outer silver paint scratched off a little bit but not too noticeable and on the exterior (I move it around A LOT btw). Probably one of my most used appliances rn, highly recommend! 10/10

reviewTitle: Works so well for blue collar worker
reviewDescription: This little crockpot is so well made! I have bought my husband at least three of the cheaply made portable warmers here on amazon, and this Crockpot blows them out of the water. Its much more sealed, which causes less wear and tear over time, and means the unit doesn't smell bad/burnt like the cheaper versions do.The size is smaller, so it doesn't fit huge lunches but its perfect for soups or curry [anything more liquid] and doesn't spill a drop! It heats evenly as well. Love this model and the affordability of it.

I don't like sharing the community microwave at the office and this was a brilliant idea I had - to purchase this and heat my foods up at my desk where only my germs are on this cute crock-pot. The portion is perfect, not too much, not too little and it heats up pretty fast. I only wish maybe their next model will have a temperature setting.

It works awesome, and it's definitely worth the money.Things to consider:1. You can eat out of the metal container, but a metal utensil is like nails on a chalkboard.  I am looking for bamboo or reusable plastic options.2. Heating food for too long is a possibility, so you can't leave it on all morning.  3 hours was too long for a hefty serving of jambalaya.  (Mushy rice.)  2 hours was just right for a serving of homemade chili.I used a timer plug from IKEA to turn the cooker on two hours before lunch for my chili, and that worked perfectly.  I think the type and quantity of food you're reheating makes a difference in how long it takes, so experimentation may be needed.  It's worth the effort, though!  Fantastic little appliance!!

I see clients in my office for the first six hours of the workday and that includes lunch.  This is so much better than a thermos for keeping soup hot!  Every single bite is hot, not matter if it’s soup or stew or spaghetti or chili or whatever!  Every bite is as hot as when it was first ready.  I used to take a bite or two, see the next person in line, then my food is cold.  Not anymore!  I’m so tempted to buy a few for home so we could enjoy hit food to the last bite.  The capacity is huge for even fairly thin broth.  Super stable on my busy desk. I’ve not idea how long it will last but my other Crock Pot is 32 years old so I’m pretty confident it’ll last.  Hope this helps you decide.

I've only used this a few times but I love it so far! My office is in a yoga studio and there is no kitchen. I have a mini-fridge in my office and usually try to bring my lunch but don't have a way to heat anything up. So I either have to bring cold things like salads or sandwiches, or eat things like leftovers cold. I'm so excited to be able to have a hot lunch. This is so convenient and will save me money by not having to go out and grab something on my lunch break.Today I brought some leftover soup I had in the freezer.  I put it in the crock pot when I got to work and it was ready in about 2-3 hours. This gives me so many more options for my lunch. Another good thing is you won't smell the food odors like you would with a microwave. I am very happy I purchased this!

Got this for my boyfriend (union electrician) and he loves it because it is a regular outlet plug in lunchbox. When he's on job sites he normally has to park far away from the building, so he doesn't have time to go get it out of his truck and let it charge in there. This one is perfect so he can plug it in in the break room and leave it there. Perfect portion size, love the steam release, nice color. He said the temperature it heats the food to is PERFECT!

I'm a teacher which means I have 30 minutes to eat lunch from the time my class walks out until the next one walks in (that is if they aren't picked up late or dropped off early). We aren't allowed to have microwaves in our rooms and even if I could my lunch usually takes at least 4 minutes to heat up and then I have to walk down the hall and not spill it. I was eating a small salad every day but now that it's colder, would like something hot once in a while. I got this crockpot, brought in cold soup, poured it in and plugged it in. When I opened it to eat lunch 3 hours later it was so hot I couldn't eat it!!! I used to use a thermos and my soup would barely be warm when I opened it. This is a total game changer!!! Worth every penny!

reviewTitle: Keeps Food at the Perfect Temperature
reviewDescription: The challenge with traditional crock pots is that they overcook what you put in them, even on the "warm setting".  In contrast, this machine is designed to keep food warm only, not to cook it.  This makes it the perfect container for merely keeping food warm, without overcooking it.  Crockpot should make larger versions of this appliance!  Of course, added benefits are the portability, leak proof, and easy to clean but the number one attribute, again, is being able to keep food warm, without cooking it to death!
Daughter used 2 times and the internal part separated from the base.  Would not recommend.
It’s such a cute product! However, the lids do not screw close easily. Getting a good seal is frustrating.
Package box is open not sure if the product had been use or not will return it
The rubber band of the inner lid doesn’t seem me a safe plastic for food. It changes the flavor of the food and caused me cough and throat irritation.
Dislike take too long heat up wasn't money

reviewTitle: I like this product it feels rugged and well built.
reviewDescription: I gave it two stars because it is too small for a decent size food warmer. The other reason is it is pricey for it practical usage. I returned it but Amazon replaced it with same, and after speaking to customer service why the replacement they told me to keep it and I will be refunded since it was re-shipped without my consent.

reviewTitle: Container lid doesn't seal that well
reviewDescription: After a couple weeks of use, the lid on the portable inner container started to twist past the threads instead of latching on tightly and was spilling food in my bag on my commute. The good news is that CrockPot still has good customer service and sent me a replacement product (different model) that works well.

Smaller than expected. I was nervous of the possibility of the crock pot being too big, however,  I was even more disappointed at tiny pot I received for almost $30. The size is Not worth the cost. It works perfectly with whatever type of food you choose to use it to keep warm.

I want to love it but the inner lid that is supposed to seal, stopped sealing after only three uses. At first, it seemed perfect but the last time I ended up with soup all over my bag. I thought maybe I forgot to scare it on but nope…no longer screws tight. Big bummer.

reviewTitle: Cute little pot, but impractical to use
reviewDescription: I hesitated ordering this, and now wish I had not.  It takes much too long to heat the food; 45 minutes for lukewarm stew (?!)  Ridiculous; my dinner was an hour later than I planned. Ended up using a saucepan on the stove.Gimmicky item that isn't worth the money.
Cannot fit anything that I like.

reviewTitle: Sent the wrong color but love the product.
reviewDescription: Works great.

reviewTitle: Looked great but too small for my needs
reviewDescription: Looked great but too small for my needs
Lid broke less than three months after purchase, and the handle is very flimsy.It does heat food, but the poor construction is unacceptable.

It warms really well but since I first got it, the lid sticks. It doesn’t matter if the plug is up or down. It’s like it is warped. A co-worker mentioned having to pry her’s with a fork. Shouldn’t have to do that.
Certainly not as pink or rose gold as pictured. Clearly a cheap made product that I’d return if I didn’t tear the box up when I opened it

reviewTitle: Please redesign the threads, we want to like it!
reviewDescription: We really wanted to like it, but ended up sending it back. The problem is the lid design. It has two lids. A threaded lid that screws down and a "top" lid that snaps into place. The threaded lid frequently pops off after it heats. At first we though it was user error and we were cross threading it when we screwed it down. But after multiple attempts, that's not the case. We'd tighten it down, look at it from the side to ensure it wasn't x-threaded and more often than not the lid would "pop" off quite loudly as it heated up. We found ourselves plugging it in earlier than we wanted to ensure it heated and wouldn't pop off after leaving. We'd come home several times to find the lid off and then you question whether or not the food is safe to eat. We just decided not to keep it. If the lid were redesigned we'd love to get another, but it actually popped off more than it didn't.We do love the portion size, the level of heating and the convenience...the lid was the dealbreaker.
El color me gustó, pero si está como defectuoso para el costo. Lo compré porque me imaginé una mejor calidad
Muy pequeña

I love my new crock Pot, it is just the right size for me, I can take soup, leftovers and so many other things to work and enjoy a hot meal instead a sandwich. It is easy to use and easy to clean. I bout it on sale and the price was right.

This is a wonderful concept. I bought this so i could have soup in the winter time when it was cold. Plugged it in and in an hour and a half i had hot soup.  Great product. I told my friends and they bought some too.  Easy to clean and store away.
Great for RV visits
I needed a small crock pot to heat up the wax for my bicycle chains. This is the perfect size, heats the wax up fast, works very well.

For Christmas I purchased one for my wife and one for me. My wife was a little unsure but has come around to loving it. As a school teacher you never know what is going to happen at lunch time. There have been times when  I put it on at 9:00am and did not get to eat until 2:00 and it was not over cooked.
I love the color and quality of this that you can bring anywhere.
This is my second one of these little warmers. I use it for lunches and it works great.

I got this after someone was using this that was working on our house. I have used it a couple times at work & it heats up perfectly. You do need to give yoursef time to heat up. The item I heated up took about 45 min.

I love this product, does exactly what its supposed to do. It doesnt stink up a room with heated food smell. Its compact and adorable, the color is consistent, the texture is nice and smooth, matte so it doesnt look cheap at all. Theres only one temperature setting but i dont have an issue with that at all. I lost the cord to this and wasnt able to use it, i messaged crpckpot asking to buy a new one and they just sent me a free one. 10/10 customer service. I even bought a second (a third?) to gift to my teacher friends to use in their classroom!!
Was a gift for my boyfriend for his lunches at work. Works super well to heat up his food <3
Extremely small and cheaply made mostly plastic.
Box was damaged when recieved with a huge hole in the side.
It doesn't heat the food.
The bowl is soooooo small.  Big enough to heat up cat food, not my food. Returned.
Bought as a gift for my husband, when he opened it the handle was broken off 😔.
Both Lids are difficult to secure.
Calling this pink is laughable.  Tan at best maybe.  I trusted it was pink bc the box says it is.  Disappointed when my daughter opened it for her birthday (outside of return time frame).
It’s work great for 3 days!! Then just diside to NOT WORK!! Paid for NOTHING

Doesn't work, at all... I gave it to my hubby as a gift and he finally tried using it at work, sadly after Amazon's return window for it... And it didn't heat up at all... Crockpot is usually a reliable brand, so I wasn't worried about testing it right away...
The outer lid doesn’t screw on properly right out of the box. Is there any quality co tell checks before sending out this product? Disappointed, will be returning.
Spent 30 minutes and the food was cold

Pros: None.Cons: This item is designed do only ONE thing (warm up food) and it failed miserably. Yes, it warms food but it shouldn’t take hours, it shouldn’t take more than 15 minutes. Also, all of a sudden, the top refused to screw on so I had no choice but to throw it away.Save your money. Bad purchase.

reviewTitle: If you returned it, never going to get your money back!
reviewDescription: Never buy from this store.  I bought a product in June 27. I returned in June 30.  To small for a hardworking man. It does not have electric connection for a car or a truck. Today October the 8,  I have not get my money back. The store has July, August, September and now October. Probably I am never going to see my money back.
Broken  looked used had grease stain on the outside and poorly packaged

reviewTitle: This is NOT Stainless STEEL Its Aluminum
reviewDescription: I did some research and the interior portion of the crock pot to hold the food is aluminum and not stainless steel. Cute but not cute enough to compromise my health and well-being. This product will be returned!!!

Takes more than an hour to heat through something like pasta or pot roast. Pretty useless. Right now I plug it in an hour before my lunch period start, and its still cold in the middle. Wouldn't purchase again.
This was to be a lunch pail, however arrived with a broken handle.

reviewTitle: Not pink. Muddy brown color. Way too small
reviewDescription: Well it wasn’t pink. It was an ugly muddy brown gray color. If it were pink as featured I would have maybe kept it but it’s too small. I never plugged it in. I just repackaged it and returned it.

reviewTitle: Not for car use as it stated
reviewDescription: It said use for car so I assumed it came with a car adapter and it does not  Very misleading

reviewTitle: Incorrect wattage in description. NOT 1500 watts.
reviewDescription: Description indicates this is 1500 watts, however the bottom of the crockpot indicates 50 Watts. After 2 hours, the crockpot heated to 130 degrees, and didn't get any hotter after 2 1/2 hours. So it is being returned.
Definitly worth it to heat up lunches. The inner container is removable for cleaning and seals well. Ill store it on its side with liquid in it and never had it leak.

My man loves his crockpot! Plug in at work and your lunch is hot by noon. It seals up with lid and extra cover to protect from leaking. He has not had any problems whatsoever. No leaks or burned food. It heats evenly but do not use raw food as this is not meant to cook food .Great for leftovers and a nice change from deli meat sandwiches! Hot lunch is much healthier!Highly recommended

I seriously LOVE my new mini crock pot.  At work, we have one microwave and many times, there's a line for heating up food, which cuts into your break time.  And I almost always eat soup or a hot dish, so I thought this was perfect for me.  It is.  No thought, just plug it in, and enjoy at break time. One of the other reviews before I purchased this said that it doesn't heat it too hot so that you have to wait for it to cool down.  I actually like my food that hot, but I found it is definitely hot enough to enjoy.  I also worried about the drier foods like rice burning, but it heats all food perfectly.  I have also put frozen prepared foods right in, and again, it is heated perfectly.  Negatives?  although 20 oz is a good size, I wish it were just a tad bigger. Like 24 oz. or so.  That would truly make  it perfect.  Also, once you heat the food, you cannot just twist the lid off. Even if you open the steam valve. I always had to pry it off with a spoon.  So now, when I plug it in to heat, I leave the lid open and just slightly off center on the pot.  No more issue.  If you are a lunch bringer, this is a game changer.

I hot this fir my 16 yr old student because she complained that the school meals were bland and at time wouldn't eat because the taste was nasty and would rather wait to eat at home. So she asked if she could take cold lunch to school but I thought my kid should get a hot realtor. So saw this and used the brand as a kid when I was her age. Granted we only used the crackpot for making beans and soups. So I felt that I could trust the brand. I git it and when it arrived to my home it was easy to use. And she now takes hot meals to school. When she just has to remember to plug it in in class before lunch so she can have a hot meal. But she has no complaints. So neither do I.

I use this every day at work. Being a follower of Ayurvedic traditions, it’s imperative that I keep my Agni/digestive fire up. So having warm food instead of cold, dead food throughout my workday is paramount. And using a microwave and killing all the nutrients in my food is just not an option. So I’m so thankful for crockpot for making this cute little lunchbox.I had this as number one on my Christmas list and also got one for my niece who is a school teacher. And she absolutely loves having this at work. I can put my leftovers in an hour or so before I’m ready to eat just so they stay warm and not cook. It keeps the same temperature and it’s just devine. This is great for my digestive system by having warm nutritious foods at the ready. This is  making my Ayurvedic journey that much simpler

This mini slow cooker is the cutest & so convenient. It keeps the temperature very hot & it’s easy to take it anywhere like work. The quality of the design and function is great. Ideal for one serving.

I am a teacher and this is perfect for my lunches. I plug it in an hour before, and my lunch is hot and not overcooked. The inside comes out for easy cleaning in the dishwasher too. I use it almost every day.
Love using this for lunches!

Bought for wife cause she only has 1/2 hr for lunch so by the time she goes to break room heats up lunch she has 10 min to swallow lunch.  I felt bad she couldn't have a nice hot lunch, was going to buy a thermos type for her food but all review said only holds heat for 2-3 hrs and so you would have to heat up first then put in thermos in the morning.  This way she takes her little crockpot plugs it in when she gets to work at lunch has a HOT meal.  loved it so much she bought two for gifts for daughter and Sister who are both teachers like her and have no time for lunch.  they loved them 100%.
Gave as a gift for Christmas and they still love it.

Update: I love this thing so much I'm ordering a second to take with me since this first one lives at work!  You can definitely forgo whatever metal this container is (they say it's stainless but it's a weird matte metal which FEELS like aluminum, but what do I know)-- I just use sealable oven safe glass 1- or 2-cup containers to transport soups and other food. The provided container does work to transport liquid, but it still terrifies me, so this option relieves me of worrying about it incessantly. That said, it's perfect for a roll on the bottom, then the 1c lipped glass above it.Everyone is right about the thread/lid/seal- simply when heating, unscrew the lid and just prop the outer lid back on if you feel so compelled. There really is no odor issue, to the point that I think it's not heating since I cannot ever detect any odors.I like my food REALLY hot, so I give it at least 1.5- 2h. And I don't bother stirring anything. Maybe I'll flip if I cram a roll or flat item in there. Makes a perfect bread/roll warmer too.Also it IS annoying that you have to unplug it, but I'm considering plugging it into a strip with an on/off switch.This second one I ordered will be the 'blush' model. I had no peeling/melting issues w the black, but it seems that the pink and other colors are terrible with the color chipping/peeling/washing off. (But why are you washing the exterior?)For these reasons and cost I'm not giving it 5 stars, but I do love this thing and it has made my general life better by providing me effortless hot food working on a freezing winter day/night. I'd give it a solid 4.25. Plus I bought this with gift cards and credit rewards points.First review:I'm REALLY impressed with this little thing! Something happened to the shipping on the first, so this was the replacement. I ordered it to my work, then had frozen my Thanksgiving dinner into the container (busy cooking all day, so was too stressed to eat it when it was all ready!), so today I brought it frozen, back to work. After about 5h transit back, I placed it into the exterior pot and plugged it in-it was still pretty frozen. When I returned to it hrs later (5-8p), it was perfect! (I had a little CP dipper which I loved and wanted to use for this purpose, but that didn't have a removable container.)I think this would have been ready much sooner, and now that I know this, I will check sooner!The only thing which bothers me is that I'm not sure what kind of plastic this is (PTFE? PFOA? BPA-free? Though the food doesn't touch it, it would be nice to not have to be concerned about fumes which would kill pet birds immediately.)It would also be nice if there were an on/off button, but I'm not complaining!The size is, frankly, huge for the amount of food I would eat in one sitting, especially at work (20 oz?!???)-- I think I ate about 6, maybe 10 on a hungry/busy day. But great for soups, I imagine. I'm going to try out something of that sort and update.The pot itself is much smaller than I expected, which is great since it's pretty inconspicuous. I'm not sure why there's a handle, since I'm not planning to carry it around like that.

reviewTitle: Super cute and mostly does it's job
reviewDescription: I was I'll so I went from the hospital into an acute rehab center. They refused to heat anything up for us. I love carrot ginger soup but with them refusing to heat it up, I was looking for something where I could heat up my own soup. This did the job but didn't really make the soup hot. Just a hotter lukewarm. It was hot enough that I could eat it but it could be hotter. I even put my soup on to hear the night before but it was still the same temp. If you want a truly hot meal, don't buy it. If your okay with it on the cooler side, than go nuts. It's cute, convenient and does the job. I took away one star because it doesn't get things super hot lime a real crockpot would.Make sure and twist the inside lid on strait or it will pop off during heating. You'll get the hang of it. Easy to wash and handle.

reviewTitle: La satisfacción de una comida caliente
reviewDescription: Compré dos loncheras, una para mi hija y la otra para mí. Una rosada en el exterior, que sería para ella, y para mi la negra con verde biche. Resulta que la rosada trae un sistema, creo, menos moderno en la tapa interior de la ollita, esta se enrosca a la vez que entra a presión, y tiene una pequeña válvula. Es muy difícil desenroscar esa tapa interior y más cuando está caliente la lonchera, casi siento que podría romper el mango de la lonchera al intentar destapar el contenedor. En cambio, la negra con verde tiene un sistema distinto en su tapa interior, esta entra a presión en el recipiente y, al calentarse, se levanta sola, entonces es muy fácil, solo es quitar la tapa externa. También es más práctico el cable de la lonchera negra con verde ya que está conectado en la parte de abajo y se enrosca en la base. Tuve que coger la lonchera rosa y dar a mi hija la lonchera negra, para mí fue chistoso, en cambio mi hija se sintió un poco desilusionada. En general, en ambos casos me pareció excelente inversión, calientan bien y si, muy satisfactorio comer el almuerzo caliente como recién preparado.

reviewTitle: Great product to bring to work
reviewDescription: I use this travel sized crock pot for work, perfect for heating up leftovers or warming up soup.I guess the only reason why I dropped it to 4-stars was because there were a few times when I was warming up soup. The inner lid that seals the metal pot will sometimes get stuck and would take a bit of time to pop open. One time I was struggling for a few minutes to get it open that I had to really pull on the lid and some soup spilled on my clothes and that frustrated me for the rest of the day.But this crock pot heats up my food well, so when it comes to warming up food instead of using the company microwave, I would say I’m content with that.

Bought for husband's lunch. He plugs it at the office or in the truck with an adapter. So far no leaks and portion control is right for him since he is trying to lose weight. He packs soups or other items. I am deducting one star because it is not convenient to store the cable under the pot. It is hard to store and husband is very forgetful so i have to put the cable right on top so he won't foget it. Also some areas of the outside pot have started peeling even though i clean it with a mild spray and a rag. It is not a big deal since it is on the outside and it doesn't affect the performance of the pot or makes it unsafe because the inside is metal. So far happy with the pot after 6 months of use.
Get it for my wife who is a school teacher and after using at school she loves it
Smaller than expected
Miu buena calidad cumple las expectativas
Bought used off a seller and came without the directions although it came in the original box. I’ll update review as soon as I use it.

I bought three of these. They are very nice except that one is defective. With a one out of three defective rate, I am taking away a star. It still works, but it will not be as longAlso, it can be very difficult to take the lid off of these at times. There have been times. I didn’t think I was going to get it off at all without breaking the thing.Despite the above, it does heat up very hot to have a nice lunch at work. I can plug it in and have a moderately hot meal about 75 minutes later. If I return to my office 75 minutes after that for a total of 2 1/2 hours it is blazing hot though not boiling. I have not checked it between the 75 and 150 minute mark due to my work schedule. Somewhere between there is what it takes to get food super hot as it had just come off the stove.Definitely a worthwhile purchase. There are just some quality control issues and they need to figure out a way to get the inner lid off better.Also, the instructions say that the outer lid is not dishwasher safe. This is weird. You should be able to put both the inner and outer lids in the dishwasher. It does not explain why you cannot do so that tells you to clean it by wiping it with a soft cloth. I only discovered this after one of them through the dishwasher a couple times

I deeply regret this purchase. This thing leaks often, no matter how careful I am to make sure the lid is on correctly and the vent is closed. It barely warms the food at all and doesn't hold enough. The lid is nearly impossible to remove after it has been on for a while, which is very strange considering how easily the soup finds it way out, time after time.  DO NOT BUY!!!

This is not stainless steel and even if it is it’s of a very poor quality and looks more like aluminium or an alloy. I love the size and look of this however, I care about my health so I’m returning. There are like a million metals listed in the description but it would be helpful to name which is which instead of misleading the buying.

The first time I used it this week to heat a can of soup I couldn’t get it open to eat my lunch. The spoiled soup is still in there, and I can’t get to open to clean it out and return the item. When I continued to try to open the mini crock, the outer casing moved instead of the inner lid. Vent doesn’t release the vapor lock.

On first use, I followed the instructions in the manual, and it did not heat at all. The red light came on, and after nearly 2 hours, my food was not warmed AT ALL. Currently working with manufacturer to get this replaced.

reviewTitle: Looks nice for the small portion but overpriced
reviewDescription: Does not have any special features- no timer, no auto shut-off... Looks nice in the beginning, but clearly overpriced.

I'm really disappointed why isn't there a chargeable cord for USB or a button to turn on without a cord? I turned on put my food in getting ready for work. Came out to lunch and my food was ice cold!!! My yeti would've kept my food hot for 24 hours. What the heck Crock Pot??? Great idea poor execution. Doesn't work without leaving it plugged like any other crock pot. So upset this one! The picture is deceptive!!!

I tested it by heating water in it, and after 30 minutes the entire unit was overheated and the sides bulged out, detaching the top metal ring from the body. Everything smelled like toxic melting plastic. It's a fire hazard and your food is likely contaminated with toxins.
Product didn't work. And they didn't give me my full refund. Don't buy From them
Barely used and it overheats

Not portable at all requires a plug to even work and it's so small a literal microwave makes this obsolete.. only useful if you need barely a serving of something at soup temperature that has been premade before hand or you have a big container to refill constantly. They way oversold this plastic garbage.. portable my rear end
Having a hot breakfast when it's 40 degrees in the back room makes me happy😁

As a nurse who is on the move and all over a 7 floor hospital all night, this is the best purchase I've made. I love it because it doesn't dry out my food. If I have to run to a code mid meal, I just put the cover back on, leave it plugged in and when I return, my food is still hot.  Microwave just cooks the food more and dries it out (if it's not soup) So far, no problems. Easy to clean and store.
The look is beautiful and it does what I need for it to do
I love this so much. I use it at work and my food stays hot.
This mini crockpot is fantastic! It doesn’t cook your food. It just makes it really hot. It’s convenient. I love everything about it.
This is the perfect size to take your lunch to work or just a single person.
Exactly what the description stated. Excellent quality that is expected from crock pot. Can't wait to use this at work!!

reviewTitle: Crock pot lunch box is handy.
reviewDescription: I have used this for taking soups, dips and pasta without and leaks or problems.  It is very handy.  Hope they will come out with one that is a little larger and has compartments.

Got this for my dad on Christmas and he loves it! He works in the office and loves the convenience of the product due to it being light weight and easy to transport. He said it warms up his food quickly and it’s very simple to use!

reviewTitle: I will never be without one of these
reviewDescription: I thought this was just a fad thing, but once I started using one, it was not. It heats my food to a perfect temperature and has never burned anything. I have piping hot meals without having to worry about microwaves. I am a teacher, and the 5 minutes it takes to get to the microwave, heat the food, and get back to eat it is enough to warrant buying this alone. I am also a big guy and eat significant portions. It holds plenty for me. I've had everything from soup to brisket in this thing over the years, and it heats them all perfectly. I've had my current one for about seven years, and I plan to order another one to keep on hand in case this one stops working.It is a little tricky to clean sometimes, but I just hand wash it every day. The inner lid doesn't stick like it used to, but it is 7 years old at this point. Still, you need to take care if you have some liquid.Overall, it was a great purchase, and I will continue to have one as long as I have lunches to heat up at work.

reviewTitle: color not the same as shown
reviewDescription: when you order pink and get a taupe piece.. that is not even on the selection list!! no where near the color depicted and no instructions included with product info.

reviewTitle: Used 3 times and it no longer heats up
reviewDescription: Love the size and look hate that I only received three uses from it.

Upon first opening, it looks junky. Just came in a plastic bag. Possibly used. You get what you pay for. Unfortunately it is made in China. Would probably have been better quality if it was made in the USA.

reviewTitle: Worked twice and has now stopped working
reviewDescription: I'm highly disappointed in this product.  I was super excited about it. I have used it twice.  And now today, I brought food for it and it stopped working.  The light isn't lighting up and it is not heating.
I like the it , bring my lunch to work. The handle is broken and the light goes on and off

Hugest disappointment! I received this crock pot used, food still on it and paint rubbed off of it on some areas. This color is so hard to find so I was beyond excited and waited over a week to get this. BEWARE!
Inner lid is difficult to twist on and off, most of the time it gets stuck. Burn hazard if pot is hot then trying to get the lid off.
I cannot get the food container lid off!RETURNED‼️

I’ve been waiting for the blush to come back in stock. When it arrived the box was intact but when I opened the box, the handle was broke and little plastic pieces were all over the inside of the box. Such a bummer.

reviewTitle: Lid won't shut, cheap outer material
reviewDescription: I couldn't use it because the outer lid won't screw on. It's just flimsy plastic. I'm returning this item.
Too small for any meal

reviewTitle: It is not what it looks like !!
reviewDescription: The main and most important issue I have with this thing since day one is the the lid DOES NOT WORK PROPERLY ! It just spins but doesn’t tighten at all, I have to make sure I put a piece of tape to keep it secure from opening every time, which happened to me a few times and dropped all my food on the floor!!Oo and it definitely doesn’t look like the one they’re showing I the picture

I can put the food in and get it hot, but can’t get the food out to eat it without two people holding it with hot its because the inside lid is defective and is so difficult to get off, the entire inner housing spins.  I used it about three times and Amazon won’t replace it.  Don’t buy this product, at least not from Amazon
Very very disappointed, the warm light came on but it never heated up or got even slightly warm

This is not just a small crock pot as we were led to believe by its name and appearance.  Instead, it can only “heat up” leftover food.  Microwaves are much more convenient than lugging this around, or, turning on hours before you need to eat.  Don’t waste your money like we did.

reviewTitle: Spare liners are no longer available
reviewDescription: My first one was amazing, I bought enough liners to make lunch for a week. You can no longer buy the liners, which makes this product 100% less user friendly.
The inner pot is a BIG LIE.it is not stainless steel.Aluminum.It leaks into foods.They should be honest.  BIG scam.
This Never makes my soups warm! AFTER 40 minutes Very barely starting to get Slightly warm!

reviewTitle: I was absolutely in love until it stopped working
reviewDescription: I absolutely love my crockpot! It was the perfect color. As a teacher it was very important to me to have hot food that I did not have to put in the microwave because we don’t have time. I came up with the perfect schedule so that I can heat my food up and my crockpot just stopped working on me. I take care of this thing because it is literally one of my favorite appliances. I am so distraught that it is not working anymore. I was just gifted this for Christmas and here we are three months and it will not heat at all. I wish it lasted longer!

I,wanted to love everything about this Lil crock pot but I just sold it at a garage sale for $5. When it's heating up your soup this plastic lid that isn't even bpa free is so hot that it's becomes soft and bendable easily. Plastic shouldn't be melted or heated like this. If they can change the material to something safer I'll buy another. But cute design, heats up soup well and doesn't leak or smell up the office. Love it when I had it. **change the plastic lid to a safer material!!
Bought this for my friends birthday. She loved it but it has come apart and it has only been 30 days. Would’ve been great if it had been more solidly put together.
This item is difficult to open especially when hot. It burns your food

reviewTitle: Amazing product, yet vastly overpriced for what it’s worth
reviewDescription: This product is a very good product however it is totally overpriced. Bought as a Christmas gift for my mom on her request. She didn’t realize it was 70$. She thought it was less. The product works well but is certainly overpriced for the options. She actually wanted me to return since it seemed like a rip off. I did insist on her keeping it since she really wanted one for her work as they don’t have a microwave. However disappointing that pricing is so steep and did seem to waiver based on color?? Would love to leave a great review as all other aspects of the product are great, yet the price is just not what it’s worth.

Crockpot warmer works nicely for soup or leftovers.  However, after one use and washing with mild dish detergent the inside of the insert looks terribly discolored.  Also, I ordered the blush color and was disappointed to see that the rose gold is colored plastic not metal.  The rose gold plastic is wearing after one use.  Wouldn’t order this color again if I were to ever reorder.  So overall warms nicely, but faulty insert.
La olla llegó sin cable para poder calentar, tendré que retornar el producto,  xq eso debió llegar completo
I have been waiting for over a year to order one but I finally did and it came out of the box with a broken valve and spots all over the metal lining. Needless to say, I'm disappointed.
Pretty disappointed it broke after just one use. Buyer beware the pink one seems to have issues.

At first I really loved this crockpot. It was small enough to carry with me and hide away at my desk. Lately I’ve been having issues with the lid that goes on top of the metal bowl. I LIGHTLY turned the lid to close up the container for it to heat up my lunch…I’ve not been able to get the lid off for TWO DAYS. It’s completely sealed shut and I can’t get it open. I’m not a weakling at all but I refuse to break my thumb to get it to open. I even tried to heat the crockpot up to loosen the rubber on the outer lining and it won’t budge. Be cautious when closing this little one.

reviewTitle: Lid VERY difficult to get on and off.
reviewDescription: I love the way it heats. I love the handle for transporting. Then there’s the lid for the food container. Very difficult to get in but almost impossible to unscrew when you want to eat. Flawed design.  Beware.
I purchased this for my husband to take to work with lunch in it but it is not a lighter adapter only electric

OMG, I love this so much. I've been eyeing this for a while and my friend peer pressured me to get it. Food was so hot and not dried out. Cabbage, rice, and chicken; I added a little oil because I was afraid it would stick. My new favorite thing!

This is the cutest thing ever and so convenient. It keeps food hot and doesn’t take up a lot of space. This is great for if you’re going to a picnic or packing food for kids when you go out. You don’t have to only bring cold foods anymore.
This is great for work when I don’t have time to leave my office for lunch. I keep a can of soup for last minute lunches and use my warmer to heat it up. Tastes better too than microwaved food.

I was hesitant to buy it, but I’m so glad I did! I put leftovers in it in the morning, plug it in when I get to work, and it’s perfectly heated by lunchtime. I even cut up frozen taquitos and put them in and they were still perfect!

Absolutely best thing since sliced bread, perfect size for one,  first time I used it, I put in raw salmon, brown rice and miso soup, plugged it in the morning at work , and it was cooked perfectly, come lunchtime and you can eat it straight from the pot. I’m also from New Zealand, so if you are in New Zealand you will need a reputable adaptor, worth every penny !!
I use this almost dailyIt’s the perfect size for making a small batch of soup or just about anything else that you don’t want leftovers from

reviewTitle: U can Carry this little Crock Pot on the go !
reviewDescription: This lil Crock Pot is so Cute.. it's great to Carry to Work to heat your Lunch or use when Camping etc. I brought 2 one for my daughter to use at Work and one for myself when I go Camping with my Son and his family. I love this Crock Pot and so do my daughter the perfect Size for on the go.
If you have a big croc pot then you already know croc pots are the best I use it almost everyday for my lunch at work Iv gotten a couple as gifts for my family and friends and they love it
Don’t use microwave so this comes in super handy. Heats fast and well. Easy to clean. Highly recommended!
I needed these for a dinner party for some warm dips.They worked out perfect
Bought this for my husband to take his lunches as he's on the road and hesting food is near impossible. Smaller than expected but work as intended..
Food is always warm and ready for me on the go!!! Everyone at the office is jealous of me!!! 😉

When I first got this crockpot, I really liked it.  However, now the internal lid will not screw on tight.  Even though it is dishwasher safe, I have only ever hand washed it.  It feels like it starts to tighten but will immediately loosen up.  Almost like it's going on crooked.  However, it won't tighten up.  I fear this is causing it to not seal and isn't heating the food up very efficiently.  It's unfortunate because I really like this for heating up lunch as a teacher with a very short lunch time.

Finally got to test it out at work this evening. Campbell's Chunky soup heats up in a little over 2 hours. Insert is aluminum, not surprising since aluminum transfers heat better than stainless steels, and is already stained from first use. Maybe the stain will disappear when washed in the dishwasher. Still had some leftover room from the max fill line with an 18.8 Oz can, insert capacity was 20 or so Oz, if I remember right. Does great at reheating soups or chili if you're in no real rush to eat.

This is the 2nd food warmer I purchased from Crock Pot. Their first model was slightly larger and easier to open. This new style is a bit more compact and the new colors look sleek. Overall, it’s a great product and works well to warm food. I turn the lunch warmer on 15 minutes before I eat to warm stir fry, chicken or veggies. To warm soup takes a little longer and I will allow it to warm 30 minutes. Food is always perfect temperature and not too hot.
My fiancé is always takes lunch to work but he’s a bit of a hardy eater so this lil thing has been PERFECT. Honestly this thing gets used about 4 times a week. Great for leftovers!

I love this little crockpot and use it just about every day at work! The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is that the inner lid it doesn’t screw on tightly, but when you heat food up in it, it’s almost impossible to take that into a little off without prying it open with a fork or spoon! I do love that it heats up my lunch quickly without a microwave.  It takes only 20 minutes to heat up food.

It is small but perfect for a daily work lunch for soup. Generally leak proof, leaked once when I didn’t put the lid on correctly, so that was my fault. It heats up the soup nicely.  Very easy to clean. I wish they would come up with a container that doesn’t need a cord when using it at work and maybe could be charged when not in use when you are home, kinda like charging your cell phone. Just an idea.
Love the item, however there was a extra plug missing, I assume it would be the cord to plug into the car.

reviewTitle: This is great, especially for teachers!
reviewDescription: I am a teacher, so I bring my lunch to school everyday. I was tired of my food drying out in the microwave, so as I was looking for an alternative I found this! I plug it in during my prep time, and by lunch it’s ready to go! It makes my food taste much fresher that way. It’s one of my favorite products!

Perfect little crockpot..  I just plug it in 30 minutes before my break and my lunch is ready 😋.  The colors, the size, the seal, and the self contained cord are all that makes it perfect.Note:  tablespoon for reference.
Calienta súper bien, es linda y tiene el tamaño perfecto para mi. Me encanta la opción del comportamiento para el cable cargador.
Got this for a coworker and my sister as a birthday gift, the both love it .perfect for winter hot lunches
So cute and perfect size for my lunch at work.
I like my lunches hot and this did the job nicely. I plugged mine in 2 hours before I ate and it was the perfect temperature. Enough room in the compartment for my leftover dinner. Highly recommend.
Bought this little gem so I could have a hot lunch without having to use the disgusting microwave at work. I plugged it in when I got to work and at lunch time I had a hot meal ready. Love it.  🥰

This is excellent!! Keeps food hot!! I purchased this for my daughter since she works long hours at the hospital it keeps her food very hot all day until she gets a chance to eat, I recommend this product wish I can give it 50 stars

reviewTitle: If you’re a teacher, GET THIS
reviewDescription: I got this for Christmas after having it on my wish list for a long time. I really underestimated how much I would like and use this!! I though…yeah I’ll use it to heat up soup…but no. I use it for everything I possibly can!!!I am a teacher and get 20 mins to use the bathroom and eat lunch. Not having to wait for a microwave to heat up my food has at least saved me ten minutes that I can actually spend EATING and not either waiting for my food to cook or to cool down, or having to stir or blah blah blah. I plug in my little pot and when it’s time for lunch, I can sit down and eat my food with no steps in between!  Not only do I not have to wait…but it’s actually the right temperature when I go to eat it! The microwave is always leaving my food not cooked enough, or cooked to much so that it’s blazing hot!! There’s usually no medium! With this little pot, my food is hot and ready to eat, but not so hot that it’s burning my mouth!  I don’t have to wait for it to cool down like I do with microwaved food.Whatever I have leftover from dinner, I pack in my little pot. The lid vacuum seals and is spill proof.  I have put Chinese leftovers in there, sloppy Joe, soup, rice, BBQ pulled chicken, noodles, etc. I’m constantly trying to figure out what I can cook for dinner that will heat up well in my pot. The only thing I have found that doesn’t work well is bread items, bc it gets too soggy. I feel silly being so passionate about a mini crock pot, but it’s actually that awesome. I’m buying as gifts for all my teacher friends!

The lunch box is small but big enough to hold a bowl of soup.  It's well made.  Easy to clean. Directions say not to put raw meat in it s it doesn't get hot enough to cook.  My food was hot at lunch and I put it in cold in the morning.
I love the look, size and quality.  I am using it at work for the added convenience of heating/cooking my food and not waiting for the microwave.
Great productPros keeps things very warm for a long period of time.ConsDo not attempt to lean it to the side with contents, it will spill out.But great product.

I should’ve read the description better because I thought it would cook food, but it only warms it up so it would be for taking it to work where there’s no microwave. The problem is it would take a while to warm it up. Not sure what the point of that is then?
Nice size for small portions.
Stilling lunchbox, warms up fast within 15min at least. Not made to cook raw food FYI
So far this seems to be working just fine. Size was not what I expected but so far it’s good for the price.
I purchased this for taking my lunch to work. Works great, no complaints.

I placed approx 12 oz tap water that started at 66.4 degrees, and plugged in device. At 30 min it reached 130 degrees. At 45 min. It reached 157 degrees. At 60 min. water reached 166.5. It’s cute,  but it will take time to warm food, especially 20 oz which is its capacity.
Love this unit.  Perfect for lunch on cold day.Only thing I would add is a second inner stainless container, so I don’t have to wash it every day
Esta perfecta para el almuerzo, 2 horas nada más para el recalentado y a comer!!!
Nice little crockpot. It can be difficult to open but works well.

I like my food piping hot. Unfortunately, mine doesn’t heat up food that hot. I’ll put soup in there for over an hour while I’m at work, and it doesn’t get as hot as I like it. Not sure if mine is defective bc my coworker says hers heats up very well. Love the portability though.
Yes, saw the pics, but you don't realize how small this really is.  Going to give it a try as I'm still working on losing a few more pounds, but it is really, really small.

reviewTitle: Took a long time to heat
reviewDescription: It was good size. It did take a long time to warm the food.

cute color options, nice quality of life improvement as opposed to a microwave, and deceptively large inner bowl. however, the exterior could definitely be better quality, some of the exterior silver paint has chipped from just a couple uses in being brought to work for lunches. also- its not leak proof. soup leaked everywhere, on everything. would not recommend that aspect, adding liquids for travel will need to be packed separately and added when ready to actively plug in. the lids on this travel crockpot are not leakproof at all and was very disappointed with the unexpected mess caused.

This was definitely one of those Tik Tok made me buy it moments, so I guess social media advertising works. The color of the green mini Crockpot was so nice and the whole aesthetic of this thing is appealing, but when I think of Crockpots I think "slow cooker". This thing doesn't cook, it can only warm food. So it's basically a small food warmer that is still slow. I wanted to use this to upgrade my office cooking, but I returned it instead. If it can't cook food why would I want to just keep a tiny amount of food warm for a long time? It's so much easier to microwave your chili the moment you want to eat it and enjoy nice hot food.

I never used this. My fault I didn't measure what this holds. I was looking for something to keep Queso warm for a dinner. The max fill line is nearly to the edge of the metal insert. Stirring without spilling would be impossible. I would say max this really holds 16 oz of anything if you plan to stir.  This is more suitable for heating a single serving of soup to eat at work.  For that I think a coffee mug and microwave are a much better option. For me it is just too small to use for anything.
I like the product, but without being able to buy additional inserts it limits its usefulness.

I purchased this, expecting to get a mini crock pot that I could use to make overnight oats. It is not a crock. There's a little metal pan liner. It may be fine for reheating leftovers for lunch, but that was not what I needed it for. Will be donating it. I suppose the pictures make it obvious, but silly me. Something from the Crock-Pot brand I expected to be a crock.

reviewTitle: The lid is very hard to put on...
reviewDescription: I was so excited for this and finally being able to pack my husband hot food for lunch. It works well and he loves it but the lid is extremely hard to get on right. It's very frustrating when you are trying to pack food quickly in the morning. It seems like the lines are not matching up correctly or something. It does warm up quickly and the food has been great. Maybe it's just a design flaw?
This is very cute and for one person. It is a thermos and not a cooker. Only meant for warming food. Do not over fill. Not dishwasher safe and copper-like paint is coming off with one hand wash.

Works well, if you place cold ziti in the pan, it will definitely take the full hour to heat. I recommend having your food room temperature when placing in unless it needs to be refrigerated when going to work. Having the food room temperature and then heat up your food would save you time.
Warms up soup perfectly! It looks a bit small, but it's actually a good amount of soup. I bought one for myself and then one for a friend. She loves it too!

It's hard to get into the microwave at work with so many people vying for its use.  This little crockpot makes a nice alternative. I liked it so  much I bought one for a xmas gift too. It heats pretty well, although it doesn't get as hot as I like. It will be good for work.

It’s not 100% stainless steel. I did the magnetic test on my inside food container and only the top half have passed the test, the bottom did not.  My friend at work brig hers directly from the crockpot company and hers passed the magnetic test. I kept mine and just put parchment paper inside to protect my food. I noted after about a week use, the food heats up super fast. Love that! It does a good job.

I am a teacher and this has been wonderful to just throw something on to heat up before our lunch time. I love that it is done and ready when I want to sit down to eat and I don’t need to reheat anything. It is pretty quick at heating up and keeps things warm for a long time. It is small enough to carry around but definitely doesn’t fit in a lunch box if that is what you were expecting. Fits nice on a desk and doesn’t take up much room. It is easy to wipe down and clean. I love this and can’t wait to use it throughout the school year.

After using it a few times it no longer works. The inside lid would get stuck after heating food (even after opening the vent). Now something is loose between the outside (plastic part) and the inner metal.I had really enjoyed using it and for the amount paid it should really last longer.

I love the concept of this item. The inside comes out to be washed separately which is convenient. I did however, expect it to be a little bigger than it is it’s quite tiny. It could hold a bowl of soup but not much more. Perfect for a warm lunch. Perfect for melting chocolate

This was a Gift ...Daughter was thrilled, she loved it, Would have loved it MORE if she had received the  Right Color ... I ordered the Pink ... Of course she was Happy Anyway, BUT I wasn't ... This is Not the first time recently that You can't seem to get my orders right.  I have ordered several of the Wool Dryer Balls recently and you can't seem to get the GRAY SHEEP right. They were ordered for a reason! I have recv'd Dinosaurs INSTEAD ... So they have became Gifts ... I checked my Orders and they were ordered correctly. Thank you for reading, I hope!  Thank You ,SJ
What I don’t love is the detachable cord. Twice I have gotten to work and forgot the cord. Kind of defeats the purpose.

I have wanted something like this for so long! I love soup, its my favorite meal and I had always used thermoses to keep it warm, but as the day goes on it would still get cool. This keeps it the perfect temp without continuing the cooking. I have gotten so many compliments on it at work. My one big complaint is that the plastic lid gets stuck so easily and with the matte material on the outside, it can be a headache to get a good enough grip to get it open. Worth the hassle though.
This product does not work well for me as it takes more than one hour to heat and prepare one package of ramen noodles. It is also really small.
The stainless steel bowl does not have adequate threads to retain the lid. The very first time I brought it to work the lid fell off and leaked all over my bag.
This item arrived broken.
Used for work lunches. Plugged in about 1hr before lunch. Stopped working after 2 days. Power light comes on but no heat. Wouldn't recommend
I loved the look of this unit.  However, I couldn't open the lid to the container.  Otherwise, I would have kept it.
It takes forever to heat up.I’ve had it on for an hour and my soup is still cold
We are returning it after my wife couldn't open it several times.  It needs a better design so it does not get stuck.
I ordered the pink color.  Be aware that the pink is not pink, it is a washed out tan/brown!
This thing is big as the size of my hand. Looks more like a kids toy
Para mi lonche pero. No me agrado es muy chico

reviewTitle: Convenient and easy to use - if you can remove the lid
reviewDescription: I love how quickly it heats up and with no food smell as that was a concern of mine.  What I wasn't expecting is how difficult getting the lid off would be.  I have average arm/grip strength and struggle to open this product.  It's not hard enough to stop me from using it, but I did wonder if I was doing it wrong at first.Someone with arthritis, or "weak hands" will most likely not be able to open without assistance.
Takes time to heat up. Good for those who are on a diet ‘cause it’s quite small :)))
Bought this as a gift. Works well, I would recommend this product.

reviewTitle: Works for my purposes, heating up cat food
reviewDescription: Yes, I bought this to heat up cat food. My cats eat organic cat food that comes frozen and I wanted a easy way to warm it up (not in microwave) to where it is not freezing cold for my cat to eat. Out of all the things I tried, this one works. However, my lid does not screw into metal insert bowl so it is probably defective...but for my purposes it doesn't matter to me. What I like is I can put cat food in it, turn it on, less than 5 minutes later it is warm to feed the cat (like in the natural) so it has saved me putting the food out 1/2 hour before covered each time with it still somewhat cold at feeding time. This is easy to clean, easy to use. No temperature setting just plug in and it is on so there is not an on or off switch, no low / high setting. I could definitely see myself using it. Works for warming up cat food out of the refrigerator.
It warms up your lunch and tastes better than the microwave. I wish the capacity was a bit bigger, but overall I'm glad to have it. So.far I have reheated soup and curry and I made oatmeal in it.

reviewTitle: Great Product! I just wish extra bowls were available..
reviewDescription: This product absolutely rocks for those on the road with an AC outlet available in cab. It warms thawed lunch in less than 45m, slightly frozen lunch about 1h15m. The ONLY downfall is that extra and/or replacement bowl inserts are not available?!?! WOW CrockPot is really missing a $ making opportunity here, I'd buy 1 extra and maybe 2. If a load of dishes isn't done every day I'd have a backup and wouldn't have to wash the same bowl everyday.

I purchased this for taking lunch to work while our microwave is replaced.  Works well , it took about 1 hour to heat soup out of the refrigerator.  I like my soup real hot. If it had been at room temperature it would likely be faster.I gave it 4 stars for practicalities.  Unless you are having a soup or stew, I don't see the use for it. Mac n cheese  or mashed food also may work. Or a burrito bowl.Otherwise,  it worked well. But takes a time. I get 1/2 hour for break. So if you forget to plug in ,your lunch will be done before you can eat.

This nifty electric lunch box turns lunchtime into a warm, spill-free culinary adventure, wherever you are! Imagine a portable, mini kitchen genie that heats up your meals in the car. Goodbye, cold spaghetti! And when you're done? Just pop the center bowl in the dishwasher. No scrubbing needed. This gadget is more than just a meal warmer; it's a statement of foodie independence. Flaunt your hot lunch style and make every meal a moment to savor, no matter where life takes you.The only wish I had for this was that it was like a large crockpot. This only heats it.

reviewTitle: Christmas gift and he hasn’t used it yet
reviewDescription: The only thing I wish it had was a car charging port that came as an option with it. The person I gifted this to drives heavy machinery for his job and has to be able to have a car charging port end to even use it while at work.

reviewTitle: Works as it should. Light weight for easy carrying
reviewDescription: Works great 👍 love how I don't have to zap my lunches.
Love the color and nice product
I really like my little crock, I use it everyday for work. The only issue I have is when I try to open it. It's hot and very hard for me to turn and open. I have to get someone to help most days.

reviewTitle: The bowl size seems for little kid's meal
reviewDescription: love the healthy idea but the bowl size is too small for adult & some part can’t go dishwasher.

reviewTitle: The Advertisement Shows Soup, Because That’s The Smartest Thing To Warm
reviewDescription: This crockpot takes forever to warm up food. Although it does warm it up to a decent temperature, it takes about an hour to get there with typical foods such as rice, vegetables, chicken, potatoes, etc. So if you want to eat and know you’ll get hungry, plug in the pot an hour or more in advance because it won’t heat up in even under half.

reviewTitle: Perfect size, easy to use & clean
reviewDescription: Great. Easy to use. Like that it has a lid for travel. I also like it has a separate dish that pulls out, which makes it easy to clean. Great for parties, football games. This would make a great gift.

reviewTitle: It takes about an hour to heat food through
