reviewDescription: Love the convenience of bringing leftovers .to work for lunch.  It heats them up really well.  The only downside is that it takes about an hour to heat through.

I bought this pot because I loved my old one, but wanted one that looked more stylish!!!  Well, I don’t like that the cord doesn’t stay in place. It seems like the cord is just a little bit too long to stay wrapped. So when the cord is wrapped around the pot it won’t sit flat.

reviewTitle: Are use this portable crockpot when I travel!
reviewDescription: I use this portable crockpot when I travel I use it in hotels and on cruises to heat up my leftover food. It’s low temperature and takes about an hour to heat up the food but I’m satisfied with it.

i LOVE this little thing! it saves me trips to the staff room microwave. i eat soup with my lunch. i’ll turn it on as soon as i get into the office and it’ll be hot by lunchtime. recently i started trying cup noodle in it and it warms it up perfectly!my only qualm is it not having an on and off button. i have it plugged into a surge protector so i can turn it on and off without unplugging it every time. hope in the future they make one with a on and off button and a timer.

This thing is so simple yet so awesome. It literally just warms your food up overtime it’s nothing special but I legit hate microwaved food I don’t know why I just do and so when I get to work I plug this thing in with leftover soup or whatever and by the time I take lunch it is hot! I have yet to experiment with other foods but I’m excited to try. The only thing I wasn’t too impressed with is the cleaning. Food tends to get stuck underneath the Vent hole and after I think it’s clean I’ll wipe it and still see soup color so it definitely holds onto the food that’s the only thing. I would not recommend putting it in the dishwasher because that’s how they get warped and then no longer fit properly. Overall awesome little item!

reviewTitle: Same issue with lid as others updated
reviewDescription: Disappointed with this as some other reviews stated the inside lid after first use became loose and will not seal I had to call crockpot as Amazon did not have a replacement it’s been 2 weeks still waiting on them to replace it I mentioned they should check their reviews as this seems to be a known issues and they are like well we will report it but nothing I hope the replacement is better but I do not have high expectations update crockpot sent a new one they have completely changed the deign issue is not they have a top that snaps on and the only way to get it off is to touch hold the outer lid part that is hot it is now a safety hazard and very tight so does not come off easily I am so disappointed in this I called customer service they have not solution
The size. I thought this was bigger and for so much money. Bought for my mom to get her meal warm... disappointed.
I can’t really say much about this. I have not used it yet, but it’s cute.

I planned to have this Lunch Crock Pot as an item in a  fundraiser silent auction. I'm disappointed it is packaged in a brown box rather than in a box with pictures like you'd see in a store.  Also, it is much smaller than expected.
My husband trued it but it doesn't heat up fast enough and it's an inconvenience to have to plug it in, would be better with a push button. Might return....
Smaller than I thought

reviewTitle: It Was Delivered in a Branded box! WTH!?!
reviewDescription: Gets 3 stars b/c it arrived in a branded box, gave away the surprise as it was a gift.
Inner lid stopped catching on threads and locking in place after about 2 uses.
I bought this and use one day and the insert lid was so tight that I have a hard time opening.
I have the blue one which is pretty and i use it a lot. Decided to get a second one for my daughter. Its not pink, its actually a beige color. No pink at all. I will return for a black one.

reviewTitle: Best thing ever for introvert lunches!
reviewDescription: Got leftovers? Need warm food but the microwave is in a room with other people? This thing is easily the BEST purchase I've made in years. Plug it in when I get to work and have warm food by lunch. It's easy to take just the insert home and wash each night.
If you’re a teacher and lunch time is limited, buy this. You will not regret it! Easy to use, easy to clean and take back and forth to school. Just buy it!
This thing is awesome. Works so good. Real nice to have warm for when driving truck

I bought this with the hope that my husband would start taking some at home meals to work with him and it did just that. He loves this little thing. Will plug right in to any outlet at the job site or into any converter in his truck. He loves to take frozen soups with him in the winter, so he plugs it in 30 min before his lunch break and it’s hot and ready by the time he needs it! Easy to clean, great size for proper portions, great quality and super easy to use!  Great buy! 100% recommend!

I got this for work, and it does what I need it to do: Warm up food.  You'll notice there is no buttons or settings, it's either on or off simply by plugging it in or unplugging it.It takes about 20-30 minutes to warm soup up to eating temp (165 or so).

For this one I was unable to take a photo or video as it was a present for my sister and we do not live in the same country. Her words: “I am unable to take it to work for my lunch as it is not permitted, but I love it because when I go to the boat with the family we can bring it to reheat the food as we spend the whole day at the boat away from home”. She stated she loved the color - I knew she would! That’s why I picked the pink. She stated she tried it at home and it worked as expected to be able to reheat her food.
Sirve para mi hijo lleve su almuerzo calienta bien a veces es algo complejo que destape la tapa interna pero sirve para no permitir derrames

reviewTitle: Use this frequently to take leftovers to work for lunch
reviewDescription: I've seen other nurses rave about this little Crockpot lunch pail as being perfect for warming up hot food from home instead of buying junk from the cafeteria or a fast food restaurant. I bought one as a Christmas gift for myself and I absolutely love it. This does NOT cook food like the big Crockpots, but it warms up previously cooked food very easily. I just plug it in when I get to work and then my food is perfectly warm by lunchtime. It's easy to clean - the food container part is completely removable from the unit and can be washed. The cord is detachable and rolls up under the entire unit for storage. I really can't recommend this little Crockpot enough.

I purchased this for my trips home every year on the train, I will pre make a couple of meals and freeze a few days before I leave and pack them in my padded lunch bag and heat them for dinner, food is so expensive for pre-made microwave garbage. I just hope no one around me complain about soup or a chicken dish heating up. I love the convince, ease and especially the color and the feel of the pot not that either one of them helps to make a great meal, but I'm sure people will ask about it and I'll probably tell them it's a Crock Pot that is used only for heating and keeping your meals nice and warm till dinner time. I highly recommend it, really so convenient and will be easy to pack in my carry on...LOL I'll be all set for the 2 nights and 2 days travel.

This lunch pot is the second one so bought for my husband after his last one was lost. They made some upgrades to the newer model like a screw on lid and the cord can be disconnected. He’s a construction worker and often works without power so he plugs it into his Milwaukee top off in the morning and he has piping hot lunch by break time. It looks small but can fit a lot of food and the stainless steel pot is easy to clean.
It takes a very long time for it to reheat your food (about 1 hour when filled up).

reviewTitle: New Color is Designed Different. The Inner Lid Comes Loose!
reviewDescription: Returned for design flaw/faulty unit.Unlike the other variations, the licorice color crock has an inner lid that threads into place. This inner lid is supposed to seal the unit and prevent leaks, but it does not thread at all. The lid just comes right off, along with whatever the contents happen to be. The other colors have a different design.
Had a previous version of this that was great. This one has a sorry interior lid. Good luck removing with hot product inside!

I just bought this cute little thing and was super excited about it. Used it at work on Saturday, worked great and my meal was delicious. Tried it again on Sunday, now it won't even heat up! The light turns on, but no heat. It's useless! Definitely returning this. Bummed out now because my food is cold :(
This is my second mini crock. I opted for the upgraded twisting cover in order to prevent spills in transit. However, it seems that getting the cover to screw on is a hit or miss event.

reviewTitle: Lid is impossible to get off
reviewDescription: Received this item as a gift. The outer lid is nearly impossible to get off. Brought soup to work and couldn't get the lid off, even tried prying it off. Very disappointed.
This crockpot was a Christmas present. It’s the end of February and it didn’t last. My husband loved it for work. I’m disappointed it didn’t last long.
I LOVED this product at first, got it for my hubby as a father's day gift. Well after a few uses the lid that hold all the food doesn't lock anymore and it leaks...
El material no es de buena calidad

reviewTitle: Blush pink is a taupe color
reviewDescription: I paid a little extra for the blush pink crockpot but the one I received was more of a taupe color.

This is an amazing little kitchen gadget! It’s perfect for packed lunch as a teacher. You can put your lunch in in the morning, turn it on, and it will be hot and ready by lunchtime! However, Ive had this product for a little less than a month, and with near daily use, the rose gold paint finish has begun to chip off. I really love this product and how versatile it is for all different types of food, and it does get the job done for sure!!
It really make your food hot as advertise but it will take you at least an hour to fully heat up your food
I mistakenly thought it plugged into cigarette lighter in vehicle but wasn't a deal breaker. My husband says it worked well and that's all I needed to hear!
This is a great product for soup lovers or small portion eating individuals. The color is great and it is built to last.

I love how easy it us to use. Just plug it in 90 mins before lunch and its ready when you want to eat. Just make sure the food isn't too dry and if you want to keep your food crispy this product isn't it. I've had rice harden and stick to the bottom and vegies get soggy. But overall happy with the product.

I  am a technology teacher and have a very thigh schedule, the teachers lunchroom Is far from the computer lab, so I eat lunch in my classroom, was tired of eating sandwiches and salads every single day, I love love love this mini Crockpot, heat up really fast and it fits perfectly in my lunch bag. REASON FOR 4 STARS:  It  left  an ugly mark line after the first used,  washed  it by hand and still there, but other than is a nice crockpot, I highly recommend it!!!

This is the cutest little crockpot I’ve ever seen! Although I wish it had the capability to hold a tad more contents, it works extremely well and I am overall happy with it. It definitely does the job!
Works amazing. When u have a short lunch and you don't have to waste time warming your food. I love it. Fits nice in my lunch box. Very durable.
To small
Warms food up great and timely

reviewTitle: 45 minutes and my soup is BARELY warm
reviewDescription: Man I really needed this to work. If you don't have access to microwave this would have helped out a lot but it's 45 minutes in and the precooked soup is barely warm. I bought a different electric rectangular lunchbox from Amazon as well and about 25 minutes in, that one had warmed up the soup. I guess I will have to plug in this one, one hour before I am ready to eat so I'm not sure I will be keeping it. This one did not come with a car adapter.

First off I thought crockpots are meant to keep food HOT throughout the day but this did not even heat up water it made it this weird lukewarm temperature. Like the metal plate itself was hot but the water/food would never be hot itself no matter how long I left it covered and heating.

Is it cute? Precious!Is it a pretty color? Darling!Does it work? Eh,Is it leakproof? NoIt's 20 Oz and unless you have something super hearty like chili or eat smaller portions it will be too small.Do I recommend? No. It's better to take your soup in a container and cheaper.

reviewTitle: Mine was defective. Hot extremely hot!
reviewDescription: In the instructions it says that it takes awhile to heat up. I did not find that to be the case. My soup was boiling in the matter of 2 hours. It got so hot that the base finally came apart. I had it for a week and used it everyday for lunch. I even found that plugging it in for 45 minutes the soup was really hot. Again I don’t think they’re supposed to heat up that fast or get as hot as mine did. I did return it.

Whenever I first got it, it wouldn’t heat up my food within 15 minutes but it was okay with me. Over time I noticed that even when I would release the heat, it would be very difficult to take the lid off. To the point where I could hurt my hand. Now I’ve noticed that it doesn’t heat my food at all. The light will be on when plugged in but no heat. I pretty much used it everyday during the work week for 2 months but not it’s done🤷🏽‍♀️

reviewTitle: Bonita y todo pero cuesta para que caliente
reviewDescription: Me gusta porque es pequeña ideal para un almuerzo pero cuesta que caliente y por más tiempo  que la pongas no calienta mucho además cuesta para desenroscarla

So, I know it reads 20 0z capacity-but reading that and seeing that....are 2 different things. Although 20 0x of food might be adequate, room to stir and eat from the container are different. Also on me, I didn't realize that the inside is metal, not ceramic. Oh, well....
The product does not heat up quickly. It takes a long time to warm food
The size is great for our use, however it takes at least 30 minutes to just get warm and if you want hot soup that could take at least 3 hours, would not buy again

The lid is EXTREMELY difficult to get off once the food is warmed up. Pulling the vent does nothing.  This is a major safety issue waiting to happen as someone is going to struggle with the lid, it will finally come loose, causing contents to splash everywhere, burning the person.  The pot also runs extremely hot. The outside of the pot gets way hotter than the older model use to.  If replacement inner pots were sold, I never would have gotten a new one.
Mine arrived today without a charger with it. Very disappointed
It’s too small,I think no one adult would eat with it and feeling full. Definitely don’t  worth it.
I have nothing more to say.
I received the small crockpot but didn't received the griddle.  I am waiting on my refund due to I reorder the griddle.

reviewTitle: Suction of lid either won’t tighten or it gets too tight.
reviewDescription: Suction of lid either won’t tighten or it gets too tight.
Arrived without electric cord so useless.

reviewTitle: Tried multiple times. Would not heat up.
reviewDescription: Never could get it to warm up. Left it plugged in for 4 hours.

reviewTitle: It's extremely cheap material. EXTREMELY CHEAP.
reviewDescription: This a very small container.
Trash

reviewTitle: Did not turn on when plugged in. I tried multiple outlets.
reviewDescription: Defective. Wouldn't turn on.

I got excited when I saw this warmer for the first time. I thought it will be perfect to pack lunch and take it to work but there are a couple of comments I want to express:1- the lid is difficult to use. I have to go around multiple times to close the warmer completely. It doesn’t seal easily. I had to give it a bit of pressure to close it.2- I know this is a “slow cooker/warmer”, but if you would buy this, you have to plant to connect the warmer hours before you want to eat. It will take long time to warm up the food. Literally, I needed more than 2 hrs to start warming up.
Demora mucho tiempo en calentar

It is so perfect in looks, size, concept. But when just out of box I opened it, put kid in, and it seemed to be slightly crooked. Then it would not come back off with serious trying by me and by my husband. Would have loved otherwise.
Only used a handful of times and now the lid doesn’t thread on right. Now leaks if tipped a little on its side.
Es cómoda pero dura muchos para calentar pero me gusta

I mean maybe It’s different for everyone, but mine took me about or up to 30 min for my food to be fully heated. That’s almost all my lunch break. It heats up the outside of ur food but not the inside - so you have to keep mixing as it heats.
Awesome for construction worker.

I use this item regularly and it works well. It'll hold about a bowl of food and is small enough not to take up so much room in the office. It will warm your food but it takes about an hour. Most of the time, the food is still cool in certain places.  It's nice to have but if you're thinking about getting it for your 30 minute lunch break, this isn't the item for you.

reviewTitle: Some changes, both good and bad.
reviewDescription: This is different from the previous version.  There is now a pin to keep the pot still while you close the inner lid. The inner lid is VERY hard to close and open. The outer lid is too easy to cross thread.  The power cable can detach.The fitment is poor.The best part is that it holds liquid better.
The inside lid gets stuck. Almost impossible to get off. Besides that, would have given it a 5.

I saw this cute little pot and bought it for my daughter. She is doing a meal plan and always has left overs. She uses this little pot everyday! She loads this thing after she eats dinner and it is ready to go the next morning. She tells me it is the best gift ever! It does take some time to warm up so she plugs it in first thing. It never gets so hot that the food dries out, even when it’s been on for a long time. Great time and money saver because most of the leftovers are used!

reviewTitle: Perfect for those who want to avoid microwaves!
reviewDescription: I was initially hesitant to buy this, based on some of the other reviews. I reached out to Amazon, and they calmed my fears. I am so glad that I bought it! I’ve even put leftovers in it, and refrigerated it overnight. When I got to work, and plugged it in, the food was hot enough to eat in an hour!

Needed soemthing for taking hot lunch for day ski classes for my kids and gave this a try .It is good for the portion size I was looking for and kept the food warm. Was able to warm the food from car power just before lunch breaks and kids loved the warm food after 2-3 hrs on snow.No leaks and easy to clean .Looking at the crockpot my friends also bought one and had convenience and fun during ski season .Happy with purchase as I bought this one after quite some research .Would recommend.
Love the convenience of this little crock.  Works well at work.
CHRISTmas gift for my niece...she likes :-)
I got this product to avoid using the microwave at work at it works wonders! I plug it in when I get to work at 8:30 and my food is perfectly heated by lunch time.
Really handy for a quick meal.
So versatile. Not just for soups. Great for spaghetti, chicken pot pie, Chinese food . Basically anything that has moisture. Heats evenly

I love for this crockpot. It’s amazing. It’s cute. It’s small enough to put certain bags and heat up really hot. If you leave it plugged in the steam, the heat will suction your lid and you won’t be able to open it very easily but love it

PLEASE! If you do not have the access to microwaves at school or work, buy this immediately. I always plug it in 30 minutes before lunch ( as a student ) and everytime the food will come out very warm. Sometimes i even switch out food if my boyfriend needs to warm up his lunch as well. Take good care of it and DONT LOSE THE CORD!

reviewTitle: Product was returned due to Aluminium cup used for storing food & heating
reviewDescription: Color : exactly as shown in the picSize : convenient size for a good portion, neither too small nor a huge cupCleaning : easy to remove the items & clean itHeating : I didn't try with food but with water & it got warm quite quicklyCharging : Detachable chord & easy to plug-in / plug-outWeight : Not too heavy, easy to carryCons: the storage container holding the food is made of Aluminium. So the Aluminium container heats the food & it's a big NO NO. Hence I had to return it.

The product is really nifty and can be used to heat a number of different foods.However it takes a really long time to heat food. I have to remember to plug it in at least an hour before I want to eat since it takes so long to heat. (nb. my food is store in the fridge so its cold when I plug in) and depending on the type of food; like meat i have to put it on for 1 and a half hours.but once warmed the food is thoroughly hot and remains so as i eat (unlike microwaves which heat the food but then the food cools quickly)

I love this product but I'm so bummed because after one month the lid no longer seals and stays on. It now just sits on top. This causes the room to smell when warming up the food. I'm so disappointed because I love not having to warm up my food every day in the microwave, but this isn't great either now. Several of my coworkers have the same thing and none of them seem to have this problem, so maybe mine is faulty? Their seal also looks slightly different, even though we bought them at the same time.

Overall I like this product, but I felt like at this price I would've expected some more basic features that weren't present.  I would've liked some kind of temperature control, but I can understand that not being there.  The thing that I don't understand is there not even being an on/off switch.  If I want it turned off, I need to unplug it which is a bit annoying.  I'll keep using it now that I bought it, but I probably wouldn't buy this again if I needed another.

I wish it fit like 2 oz more to hold my soup I eat on my diet, but i can deal with that. The problem is, I plug it in and it starts leaking EVERYWHERE after like an hour. It didn't come with any instructions, If I happen to go to lunch before it starts leaking all over my desk, its leaking when I walk with it...and I work in a hospital, so obviously I can't ignore the fact that I'm leaking fluids everywhere for someone to slip on. I'd rather not spend my 30 minute lunch cleaning up chicken broth.

This lunch box is very cute!  It is also cute and comfy for travel purososes However, it really works like a slow cooker.  You need to give your food about 2 hours to get it really warm.  I expected it to work faster/better being it is a name brand product.Suggestions:  I wish it had a car plug, for long travels

reviewTitle: Takes a long time to heat up
reviewDescription: This has been really nice to have at work when I don't want to waste part of my break heating my food, but you have to remember to plug it in an hour beforehand. I tried just doing 30 minutes, but it would just be lukewarm or still cold by that point. Most of the time a whole hour is needed for it to be the best tempertature.

$30 is too much for this.  $20 is about right.  Convenient for my desk at work, I leave the shell and bring the liner.  Made my chili seem a bit more watery, and after first use, left marks inside the inner liner pot (again on 2nd use).  Best feature - I don't have to trek to the microwaves and wait in line.
Not like in the picture

The crockpot heats my food really well so I love that. However, the paint has started to chip off and I just bought this not even a month ago. The paint started to chip off after 2 uses without using any cleaning products. Wish the quality was better for this color.

reviewTitle: I did get to use it yet because it is too small for me
reviewDescription: Too small

reviewTitle: The gold trim melted and leaked everywhere.  Will have to return.
reviewDescription: The trim melted and leaked everywhere

It doesn’t come with any adaptive plugs for autos.. so it’s not for “on the go” until you spend another 20$ for the conversion plug.. Not Cool…Pretty sure I could have found one that came “born” that way, if I’d noticed.. my fault!

I received my lunch crock as a gift a few months ago. It was great for lunch at my office, I’d plug it in about an hour before lunch and my leftovers were piping hot and ready to eat. I noticed as soon as I got it that the lid was pretty difficult to open, especially once the food was warming up. But with the little pin, I could manage to use the leverage of the outer crock to open the inner lid. This worked until today, the metal inner part of the heating element turned with the inner bowl and lid. The outer plastic is now sticking out and exposing the heating element, and I don’t feel comfortable using any longer. If this design is improved, I’d definitely consider purchasing another.

My boyfriend got me this for Christmas and I love the cuteness of it even though it really takes a looooong time to heat soup and left overs. You literally have to wait like 2 hours or so eat whatever you put in here so I think this is good for when you know you’ll be hungry in 3 hours so might as well start heating it up early.The design is great - there are a lot of parts to it to clean and be mindful of- like the top and actual warmer and then there’s another top over the top.There should be an on/off option for this or a timer since it’s just plug in and that’s it.Also since it has to be plugged directly into an outlet, the cord should be a lot longer to accommodate the a decent distance from the wall.Overall it’s cute and compact - just needs a few options to make it less complicated to use.

I love the concept. I have an older version and I love it! That's why I purchased another one, but I like the original much better. After the food is heated, the suction to the lid makes the lid difficult to remove.

Firstly, this is adorable. And it heats soups and stews very nicely. And it's small, so you don't feel like you're eating from a trough at your desk.Sadly, it can be a little messy. There's the outside cover, which seals pretty well; and the inside cap cover you twist down on the food bowl. This does not seal, intentionally, probably(?) to allow it to let off a little steam.  As long as you know this, and rinse your used vessel out before tossing it in your tote, you might not get the remnants of your chili on that work you had to take home with you.The cord wrap is nice, and carefully engineered, but I don't have the hang of it yet, so a couple times I brought the food but not the cord, so it was pointless. I can't decide why I haven't bonded with this, because it's great to have tidy, hot food at my desk, and cleanup isn't bad, but I wanted to like it better.I will edit if it grows on me, or if I discover any tips to share.

reviewTitle: Crockpot does not sell a replacement inner lid!
reviewDescription: I like this little crockpot, but I misplaced the inner lid and the pot will leak without it if not kept completely upright. Hard to believe the company does not offer a replacement to purchase.
Funcional perono deja la comida caliente, solo tibia.
Returning my item because it was scuffed and scratched
Smaller than it looks in the pictures. Alot smaller.
I REALLY WAS EXPECTING THE CROCK POT TO BE BIGGER. IT WAS NOT WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR BUT WILL MAKE IT DO FOR MY TRIP. TOO SMALL FOR WHAT I NEEDED IT FOR....
No me gusto porque se demora mucho para calentar punto!!

reviewTitle: Love it but lid doesn’t tighten after 2 uses.
reviewDescription: At first the inner lid stay on tight. I used it twice and hand washed both times. Now the inner lid just spins and doesn’t get tight at all. Is there a way to get a replacement lid? I use mine for soup and soup without a tight lid is a bad combo.

Product works well enough, I bought it for the crockpot name mostly because there are so many variations of heat up lunchboxes now. It does heat up well and get it food smoking hot, however the lid does not stay tight at all and it is far from leak proof. Do not tip over! Wish they would’ve just made the lid metal and truly leak proof.
The inside does not hold a lot of food

I wish I could love it. Unfortunately, the inner lid doesnt tighten. No matter how hard I try the lid doesn't seal (with or without food). It' just so stinking cute, but useless if I want to bring soup.
It arrived well packaged, but there was a piece broken off where the cord is supposed to tuck in for storage, so I sent it back and decided not to reorder.  I bought it as a gift.

reviewTitle: Cute, BUT the paint wipes off at the slightest touch
reviewDescription: I was super excited about this little crockpot, it's adorable and works well. However, the first time I tried to clean some soup off the outside the paint started to flake and rub away in places. Super disappointed.

reviewTitle: Takes way too long to heat up
reviewDescription: I plugged it in in the morning so my soup would be hot by lunchtime. It was only warm. Waste of time and money
This thing is totally a piece of garbage. I wish I had not purchased it. I tried to heat up lunch, and after an hour, my food was still lukewarm. I threw it into the garbage.

I was so excited when this item arrived, but I could not for the life of me take the lid off.  It is seriously sealed shut.  I had a few friends take a run at it and no one could get the lid off.  I guess I have to send it back.
The handle was broken. Although the damaged box was completely taped shut, the pieces of the broken handle were not inside.
I bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She went to use it for the first time today (2/20/24) and it doesn’t work at all. Unfortunately it is out of the timeframe to return.

Waste of money. The term portable makes you think… you know.. it’s portable? Bought this for my husband who works outside all day. I assumed this was something that could be charged and used.. portably.. Wrong. You must have it plugged in to work.

Please do not purchase with intent of heating up left overs or for soup, or what have you.I purchase 3 for Xmas gifts for my work besties.NOPE. False advertisement!They can't even hold 2 cups of liquid let alone meal.

I did not know it was used it’s very dirty has greasy finger prints all over it. Not pleased with this outcome. I was very upset that it was used, this was a Christmas gift, not pleased it was used & dirt. It’s what she wanted but not used!
Product came damaged. The side seams was bowed out in two sport. Really disappointing. Returning & trying for a replacement. Hoping it isn’t the same way.
Used product one time and it started smoking, smell of burning plastic etc. Amazon no help in refund return.

reviewTitle: Overall this is great, just a minor complaint
reviewDescription: I bought this Crock Pot food warmer about a month and a half ago, and have used it quite a bit for lunches at work.  It works as advertised, heating up your meals, having them ready anytime you are.  I've made soups, stews, and similar things in bulk. refrigerated or frozen them, and then reheated them in the mini crockpot.  My only complaint, which is a minor one, is the finish trim color around the upper base of the unit, which is apparently painted plastic, is coming off (see pictures).  Not really a big deal.  It's not in or around the inner container, so I'm not worried about that getting into the food.  But it's something that could be improved ,

reviewTitle: Takes a while to heat up
reviewDescription: Got this to take to work. It took over a hour to heat up food. Now I know to plug it in right away in the morning. I like having the option to take stews/soups to work with this.

Great item, heats things up a little slower than my other similar crock pot but does the job.The lid is also very hard to remove but that is most likely to keep the contents from spilling out. My wife loves the color and likes the size and durability.
This compact food warmer is a lifesaver. It allows you to carry leftovers to work, saving you money from buying fast food.

reviewTitle: The cutest little crock! Easy to store, easy to use
reviewDescription: As I sit here eating my lunch from the cutest little crockpot, I felt compelled to write a review. My favorite feature of this crock is that you can keep the item at work and bring home the inner chamber to wash and return back. I have found that it works better and faster with soups and liquid-like foods than items such as pasta, which take a bit longer to heat up. I have heard of using it to keep butter melted for parties, which is genius. It is a great item (and the cutest little crock) to have if you bring your lunch to work regularly.

I love this crock-pot a lot. I really enjoy a hot meal for lunch when I'm at work. It's also good to make instant noodles as well. However, I don't think it is quite well built because the case is already a bit out of shape after a few days. It still heats well though.

So far this thing does exactly what it supposed to. It does a great job in reheating food. If I have bone in chicken and mashed potatoes, it usually takes about 45 minutes to an hour for the food to get hot hot. So this is my second mini crockpot I had one years ago, and there are things I prefer on the new one and then other things I prefer on the old one. I love that the lid on the new one screws on Now. I don’t have to worry about food spilling out of the bowl.  The cord on the new crockpot is detachable now, not an improvement I’m my opinion. I suppose it’s for ease of storage or maybe so it’ll wrap nicer but for the life of me I cannot get the cord to stay wrapped up. It’s like the cord is just a hair too long so the plugs don’t stay in their designated spots. They are forever popping out. That is pretty frustrating.  I’m usually carrying a handful of things from my car to office every morning and having to put it all down to pick up the cord that fell off the bottom of my food warmer halfway through a fleet yard is not joy. I think I’m gonna try Velcro. See if I can’t find a way to make it stay. I love the color of mine. I got the green one, but the paint on the small gray rim that the lid screws into it’s already wearing off and I’ve only had this for about a month now. I don’t really wash the base of the mini crockpot but I spot clean it. The paint hasn’t rubbed off from excessive wear and tear or too much of anything like that. It’s just doesn’t stick that well I guess. This item lost a star because of the paint and the cord issue.  It works great and does what it supposed to do and it’s not giant like the other food warmers I’ve seen.  overall happy with my purchase..
Perfect for my noodles and the size.fits my lunchbox
This is very cute and functional. Although, it does take quite a while to heat up your lunch. If you have the extra time it would be great for you.
I use mine for lunches at work. It heats well and is easy to clean. The cord storage is iffy, Not sure how long it is going to hold as it does not snap securely in place.
Hard to open the lid without spilling.

No longer have to use the nasty microwave at work. I’ve put everything but soup in this little thing and as long as I remember to plug it in, I get a hot lunch. The only complaint I have is screwing in the lid to the inner container. Mine seems to have a hard time going on straight. If I did take soup, I’d want to screw the lid on tight and it’s kind of a pain to get that lid off if you get it on tight. I do wish I could purchase an additional inner container. Sometimes I’d like to just put it in the dishwasher instead of having to wash it every day by hand in order to take my lunch. I also wish it had an on/off switch instead of having to plug/unplug it.

This is a very convenient "lunchbox" if you don't have access to (or don't like using) a microwave.  It doesn't cook food, just reheats.  This holds a lot of food (at least two cups).  I haven't put any compact foods into it, mainly soups/chilis and loose pasta like spaghetti or soba (no lasagnas or casseroles). Some stuff requires just a little bit of liquid to help with the reheating. My only two complaints: 1.) You have to loosen the internal lid before you start cooking, otherwise it tend to get stuck.  The last thing you want to do is fight with a lid that's holding back hot food.  This happens with or without that little black venting plug on the top. 2.) After the first use, my power indicator light stopped working.  I tried the unit and it still heats, so this isn't a deal breaker.  Reheating time takes some trial and error but once you work it out, it's easy to use.  I like my soups really hot, so at max capacity, it was 1 to 1.5 hours from refrigerator cold.

I’ve been eyeing this for a while now and finally got around to getting it. The idea of having a hot lunch without going to the microwave in the office break room sounded appealing to me. Anyways, last night I added some leftover chicken congee (rice porridge) into the metal container and covered it with the plastic cover that came with the unit and left it in the fridge. Grabbed it on my way out of the house. When I got to the office, I plugged the crock pot into the wall unit at my desk. After about 4 hours of working I started to get hungry so I opened up the crock pot and man oh man was this thing hot !! I had to use a napkin to hold the side of the metal bowl down while I tried to pop off the plastic cover (hence the 4 stars). But once that lid came off and I can smell the garlic and chicken I knew this was going to be a tasty lunch. The fact that my congee was piping hot the whole time I was eating was nice. Cleaning everything was a breeze. I love how the cable disconnects completely from the unit and that I can keep it hidden while still on the unit. I can’t wait to try this again!
Super cute and easy to use. BUT they sent the wrong color.

reviewTitle: Received as a gift and then bought 3 more as gifts to others!
reviewDescription: This is fantastic for a nice, homemade, warm lunch that isn't dried out or unevenly warmed up from the microwave! The temperature is evenly hot throughout and the food retains its moisture! I do love it! The only criticism I have is the inner lid is difficult to remove when the food is warmed up because the inner grip is too short and doesn't allow enough torque to twist off.

reviewTitle: Not too hot, in a good way
reviewDescription: I have used mine mainly for soups at work. Fill it up and plug it in. Soups on in an hour! It doesn't get steaming hot but it does get a sufficient level of hot, at least for what I personally prefer in food temperature. No burning the roof of my mouth or tongue.Took some leftover Carabbas chicken pasta in to work and it heated up perfectly! It does take about an hour and I forgot about it and it heated for 2 hours. My pasta wasn't stuck onto the metal container, it was great.Tonight at work we had make you own burritos catered in the studio. I got to the food late so it was cold. I filled the bowl with chicken chunks, black beans, crushed tortilla chips and cheese. Heated it for an hour and it was great!All my coworkers are jealous with the exception of the two who ordered their own after seeing mine4 Stars for the handle. That things gonna break if it ever meets the pavement on accident.Cleaning is a breeze!

I had  gotten one of these during christmas one year and ended up losing it. I bought this newer version and enjoy it a lot more.PROS: It's a nice thing to just easily heat up your lunch/dinner while you're working throughout the day (or nacho cheese). I do like the screw-on lid (also a CON) compared to the order model where it just was pressed in. NOTE though, you do need to stir your food every now and then to make sure it heats up as fast as possible. :)CONS: Only two things, the screw-on lid (for the one with the bowl) to me tends to be a major pain on getting it undone every now and then. It's like I have to wait for it to cool a bit. The second, as mentioned by other reviewers, is that the power cord doesn't stay well with it being wrapped up. While I haven't had it fall off yet; it's not exactly secured to it. (the prong side)It is a great product and I would be another one again if I thought I needed to!

reviewTitle: Great to avoid microwave jams in office
reviewDescription: This is a great little gadget for heating lunch at the office.  Sometimes reheating soups or pastas can get messy in the office microwave, and while I don't mind cleaning up after myself, I'm not cleaning up Betty's exploding lasagna from last week!  I usually try to give it at least an hour and have always had my food nice and warm-even heating from frozen.  I keep the base in my office and use the inner container to transport my lunch. I've not had an issue with leaks and that's honestly my one complaint.  I don't know what science rule I'm missing, but sometimes it is a STRUGGLE to open.  Even with the little spiget popped, I was worried I was going to break it trying to fight whatever forces had created the perfect seal. So my lesson learned is to make sure the inner lid is not screwed in too tightly, barely twisted, to make it easier to open.  All that to say, I love it and use it about 2x a week.

The quality was good. Not worth the price for our family as it is very small. If it wasn’t so pricey it would work great for cheese dip at a party.For work it wasn’t practically because I really have no where to keep it warm all day before lunch.

The little thing is cool. I take it to work with me for lunch, it works amazingly and it’s better than putting my food in a microwave. I do fight with wrapping the cord at the bottom base trying to get it to fit right. I gave it 3 stars because you see in the photos the lip on the pot is wearing off. I don’t rough handle the little thing, but the lid seems to give it its wear. I’ve only had this for 2 weeks so it’s sad to see it’s starting to wear.But in all, it’s cute and it does the job when I’m ready to eat my lunch.

This Crockpot works fine to heat foods. Takes about an hour and 1/2 to heat my lunch. I gave it 3 stars because the inner lid doesn't fit well. Sometimes I have to pry it off. Also, the cord storage is very inconvenient. I don't enjoy using it.
I have only used this crockpot about 10 times and it just stopped working.  I was very careful not to get any electrical parts wet and used as directed.
Takes L O N G  as in many hours to cook food just heating up leftovers took 2 hours.

reviewTitle: Fell apart after a few uses
reviewDescription: I don't have a dishwasher so I washed it by hand and after only a couple of weeks use at work (not every day) the outside pink lining was separating from the metal bowl and now the lid won't go on bc of it. I guess I'll check out those warming lunch boxes that everyone's trying now....

This little crock pot is worth it to take to work.  It warms up my food- roast, chili, soup.  Perfecto!  There is only one button, so no warming feature.Now, I've washed it a few times and the paint on it has come off easily.  The durability is in question because of this. Would be 5 stars if it wasn't the paint and if it had a warming option.

reviewTitle: Very cool but gets hot fast
reviewDescription: Plugged it in at 9:30 AM and by 11:00 it was too hot! Works good but I recommend waiting until about 1/2 hr to 45 mins to turn it on.

reviewTitle: Food container is made of ALUMINUM.
reviewDescription: I love this little food warmer, however, I discovered the interior food warmer is made of aluminum! I don't heat and eat out of aluminum. Could you PLEASE offer an alternative stainless steel or even glass. Preferably stainless steel. Otherwise it works perfectly and is fast to heat. The size is perfect for me.

This crock pot functions as listed, and comes in fashionable colors. However, I’ve had two separate occasions where the lid becomes stuck and won’t come off. On this days, I don’t get to eat my lunch :(.

I bought this lunch crock because it’s supposed to be blush pink. The one I received is nowhere near pink. It looks like a dark taupe color. Other than being super disappointed with the color, I’m sure it will be fine for heating up lunch items.

I really like the color, size, and convenience of this portable warmer. I thought I was purchasing an actual mini crockpot cooker though. It does not cook, but I am able to take soup, rice, etc. to heat up for lunch at work.  As long as you know that it’s not a cooker, you won’t be disappointed.

I have been enjoying this pot. I only have difficulty with the inner lid. I wish that it screwed on, sometimes I can’t get it on tight enough. Other than that, it works and it heats up my meal in less than 3 hours.
You still have to precook whatever you plan on putting in it, but it is an excellent way to have a warm or hot meal at work.  Small, compact and can hold enough food for one person for one meal.
I am on the go for my job and this makes lunch a no Brainerd. It does take a bit to heat up your food but I expected that from a mini crackpot. It does the job well and evenly heats your food
Cute little  warmer but it takes a little longer to warm up the food. So prepare a head of time.

reviewTitle: Perfect gift for hot lunch at the office.
reviewDescription: This is a gift for a friend.
This is very convenient and a great idea.

reviewTitle: Great little product for making soup for lunch
reviewDescription: This works great for heating up soup for my lunch.  It works well, and it’s very portable.  There are 2 problems…. 1) I cooked broccoli soup in it, and the smell of broccoli was retained in it.  I can’t get that smell out.  2) As it heats up, the lid gets tighter.  So I have a lot of difficulty removing the inner lid when the crockpot is on.  Since it’s plastic, I am concerned this life is going to break.

So I've only had this thing for a couple of weeks, but so far it is wonderful. I've only used it for things like pasta and chili, but that's not unusual for my lunch. Unlike microwaving it, I just plug this thing in an hour (actually it's been closer to two hours because I'm afraid that I'll forget about it until the last minute).When it's lunch time, I have a meal that isn't half frozen/half mouth-burningly hot. Rather it is all uniformly hot without me having to stir it, put it back in the microwave... etc.I don't know why, but the texture of my pasta isn't as bad as when I microwave.
The description states it is made of plastic. The outside is plastic, but the inside is metal. What kind of metal is it??Thanks, Becky

reviewTitle: Takes a long time to warm up.
reviewDescription: Takes a long time to warm up and it does not warm the food enough.
If for a kid good but this thing is small can’t even hold a full meal for an adult
This is MUCH smaller than expected! Being returned! Don’t need a crockpot for soup- about all that would fit!
It was pretty small for a man size portion of lunch
Lids are not leakproof. Tiniest tip of the pot causes it to leak, and right into the base potentially damaging the unit.
I wishlist was a little bigger.

reviewTitle: Takes too long to heat up
reviewDescription: Holds a can of soup fine just takes forever to heat up. Fine if you have plenty of time to wait.
It’s not one peice and it’s not 12 volt for truck drivers with a seal proof lid tight lid
Does not heat food evenly or hot enough. I was very disappointed.
Too small for our use

Absolutely love! It works great and is perfect for on the go or in the office. I love that it can fit on a desk and doesn't give off food odors. It also has a container with lid so you can store your food. Will be buying another!

As a teacher, I am picky about items I use in the classroom. This fits the bill! It holds a good amount, heats my lunch well, and there is NO smell to fill the classroom while it heats up. I'm not crazy about the detachable plug because it doesn't stay where it should for storage, BUT- I solved that by keeping the cord at school instead of lugging it back and forth. It's nice to have my meal ready at lunch and not have to que up for the microwave. Highly recommend!

reviewTitle: I love this little crock pot
reviewDescription: I'm a teacher, so I keep this at school in my classroom.  It's so easy to clean and tote.  I bring the innards with me in the morning, place them in the croc and they are ready by lunch.  It cools down quickly as well.  I have used it every day since I bought it more than a month ago.My only complaint is sometimes the top doesn't come off, and I have to use a key to break the seal.  I worry about that over time.

I use this in my office almost daily!  Great for leftovers, or preparing simple precooked meals. I load it up with whatever I have in the fridge or freezer play it in and by lunch time it’s hot and ready to enjoy.

Wow I really impressed by this food warmer. Not only is it compact and the blush pink (more mauve) is pretty, it holds a good amount of food, and heats food in 1-2 hrs.Just tried it for the first time at home and it warmed my rice porridge to very warm in about 1.5 hrs. The food is hot but a comfortable hot for eating. I added some soft tofu and sauce on top after my porridge finished warming. Also tried it with my vegan mac and cheez chili and it took about 1.5 hrs to warm.I like that keeping it plugged in, I can slowly eat my food without it going cold. I have a bad habit of eat food over a long span of time if I’m preoccupied.The only issue I had with it was taking off the inner container lid when I first opened the package. It was wouldn’t come off. My bf was able to get the inner lid off the inner container with his strength. Since then, the lid has come off without problem.

This is my first and only Crockpot electric lunch warmer and I love it. It heats up my meals and keeps them warm. I've heated homemade soups, and fried rice, and it took my soup about 35 minutes to get hot after removing from refrigerator (only inner pot needs to go in refrigerator). I've even heated scrambled eggs that I made the night before and had them for breakfast at the office the next morning with coffee and avocado toast. 😉Don't let the size fool you, it holds a good portion.I purchased the blush pink and  it's a really pretty color.UPDATE:I bought this little Crockpot back in May 2023 and it is now December and I am using it to heat up soups and other meals a couple times a week since it gets now cold in my area (NC) and it is still working great. The inner pot does get a little stained but not a big deal. I always hand wash the inner pot and lids and just wipe the outer sides of the pot if needed. I've never had any leaks but then again, I always make sure not to go past the "max fill" line. I carry it in my cute 😍 lunch bag (also from Amazon) and it fits perfectly. I love my Crockpot.

reviewTitle: The pink color is not as shown in the picture, and it is ugly.  Works great, however.
reviewDescription: I bought the pink one. I regret that now the color isn’t really pink it’s the sort of ugly gray yuck.  I am OK with Dusty Rose, and this is not dusty, rose. The metal band around the middle is the correct color but the plastic need some help.  Aside from the fact that it’s ugly it works very well.  I had a little bit of trouble getting the inner lid to screw on exactly.  In the end, it’s sort of kind of on and  is good enough.  Certainly not leak proof. Washes well In the dishwasher. Adorable little carrying handle and brilliant way to wrap the cord around the bottom.  You can use the lids or not while heating. Obviously that will speed it up. The unit does get a little bit warm, but certainly not hot on the outside.  I would not put it on top of a laptop or some thing, but it’s probably fine on the counter.  I really enjoyed not having to use the communal microwave. I really love how well it heats up in three hours food from the refrigerator, including big pieces of potato.  I love how you can use the lid or not, I love how there is exactly 0 buttons to break. If it’s plugged in, it’s on, if it’s not it’s not.  I love how adorable it is.  It’s a decent portion for one adult.  You obviously can put less in it if you choose. Now I’m on the hunt for extra inner bowls and lids.

My husband works outside for the union in the freezing cold temperatures off the water of New England winter. It’s always looking to save a few bucks and get a warm meal in his belly at lunch. This was super easy for him to run off of his Milwaukee battery ports. Everything else we tried had too high of a wattage and wouldn’t work. This the best thing ever he’s been using every day for months with all sorts of variety of things even cuts up pizza, meatballs, lasagna, soup, dips with breadsticks. There’s so many options. Great value

I love the concept of this crock pot. I take lunch daily for work and it’s very quick and easy to use. I prefer not to warm my food up in the microwave so this is very handy. It’s also very easy to clean and travel with.

The Crockpot Electric Lunch Box has single-handedly revolutionized my lunch routine at work! Gone are the days of waiting endlessly for the office microwave to free up. Now, I simply sit at my desk, plug in this marvelous gadget, and in just an hour, voilà! I'm indulging in a piping hot, delicious meal that tastes ten times better than anything zapped in the microwave.What truly sets this lunch box apart is its ability to retain the flavors and textures of my meals. I've experienced a noticeable improvement in the taste and consistency of my food compared to using the office microwave. Whether it's warming up my favorite homemade soup or reheating last night's pasta, the food comes out perfectly warm without any sogginess or uneven heating.And let's talk about the convenience! Its compact size fits neatly on my desk without taking up much space, and the secure closures ensure no spills during transport. Plus, it's a breeze to clean—the removable stainless steal crock is dishwasher-safe, making maintenance hassle-free.But the real game-changer here is the absence of any lingering food odors. I can't stress enough how amazing it is to warm up my lunch, like my "aromatic" riced cauliflower, and not have a whiff of it lingering around my workspace, offending those around me! It's as if the lunch box magically erases any food smells while keeping the flavors intact.In short, the Crockpot Electric Lunch Box is a lifesaver for anyone seeking a superior lunchtime experience. If you're tired of the microwave shuffle and want to elevate your meal game, this is hands down the ultimate solution. Highly recommended for its convenience, taste preservation, and odor-free warming!

The item looks nice but I give 1 start for heat-up time. 1st I have cold food and plug-in 15min. Still cool ( I mean cool) and at 2nd time I plug in for 35min. Still a little warning ( compare with microwave 45-second heat time) I would not recommend to anyone trying to buy this item for heat up food. I have no idea what is this one purpose for.🤷‍♂️

I had this for about three months when the plastic piece on the insert disappeared. Not sure if it broke in the dishwasher or what happened to it. So I contacted Crock Pot through Amazon, who wanted pictures of the item - the item number - the date code - the sticker on the bottom - proof of purchase...seriously? I just wanted to know if I could replace the piece of plastic. I'm throwing this out and buying something better.
Takes too long to heat.  Very small no on/off button.
The pot worked a few times but it doesn’t get hot anymore i don’t know what happend it was working good until all the Sudden it’s lifeless….very disappointing I was hoping I could use it every day….
No lleno mis expectativas y mis necesidades
Seems like a good design, but no way to know if it actually seals. The outside top wouldn’t screw back on no matter how many times I tried.
This is not for someone who a senior who has limited grip strength in their hands. I should have paid more attention to the ratings that mentioned this fact.

reviewTitle: Needs Manufacturing Process Help and Quality Inspection
reviewDescription: 1. Color says Pink but is actually tan.2. The inside lid does not fit on the pot.3. Not sure how safe these materials are.Returned
Just got it for Christmas and now it is broken!!
Rice cooker used once, rice burnt.  Will not work anymore.  The button would not stay down in cook mode.

reviewTitle: What? I just don't get the appeal.
reviewDescription: I got this on a 50% off deal and still feel it was way overpriced for what it is. I returned the item knowing I wouldn't ever use it.

reviewTitle: Easy to use but has a few flaws with the lid
reviewDescription: It’s easy to use and easy to clean overall. But minus one for the lid being a bit hard to adjust/close. Another minus one for the speed, it takes about 30-40mins to actually start getting heat up.

reviewTitle: Stopped working after 3 months but customer support made it right
reviewDescription: I really loved having this small crackpot to warm up food, however, it stopped working after only intermittent use in 3 months. Contacted customer support to troubleshoot the issue. They are in the process of sending a new one. I appreciate the company trying to make it right.
You really can't fit a human sized portion into this crockpot.  I loved the idea, just disappointed with my portion size I guess.
I have used one of these before and loved it. My only issue with this one is that I never received it. My order info still says delayed… 4 months later
Cute and convenient device. I should have paid more attention to the serving size, it's too small for my use.

reviewTitle: This is not a blush pink color, It is a taupe tan color!
reviewDescription: It is not a blush pink, which is why I ordered this one.
I really like the crockpot but the size is too small! It can fit maybe a small cup of soap but not a meal.

reviewTitle: I received the product without its original box and paperwork
reviewDescription: I received the product without its original box and paperwork
Could allow for a larger portion size.
